ShortDescription: Person tested positive to Covid 19 in camp
FullDescription: Person tested positive to covid 19 in camp.  Required to isolate for at least five days.
ImmediateAction: Isolate for at least five days

ShortDescription: Scaffolder struck thumb with hammer causing minor sluice of skin from nail
FullDescription: Scaffolder struck thumb with hammer while punching down a nail, causing minor sluice of skin from nail. IP was wearing gloves (EN388 - 4,4,4,4,E)
ImmediateAction: Reviewed the injury, applied a band aid and IP returned to work. Reviewed mechanism of injury and work method, no issues.

ShortDescription: IP reported eye irritation
FullDescription: Whilst working on the Ethane Disposition project IP experienced an eye irritation linkened to dust in eye.
ImmediateAction: Immediate care management was provided and the IP was taken to the guard house as per the site protocols.  Eye was flushed no foreign object found. IP taken to optometrist for further care. Drug and Alcohol testing has been arranged.

ShortDescription: Wood employee tested Antigen Rapid Test (ART) positive at an external Clinic.
FullDescription: Wood employee was not feeling well and went to clinic, where Antigen Rapid Test (ART) was conducted. The test result was positive. He was given medical leave as per MOH protocol.
ImmediateAction: Self-isolation to be carried out at his residence as per MOH guidelines. Disinfection was carried at his desk.

ShortDescription: One (1) Massy Wood employee tested positive for COVID-19.
FullDescription: One (1) Massy Wood employee tested positive for COVID-19 during round of antigen testing on site.
ImmediateAction: Employee taken to quarantine location to await demobilization from installation.

ShortDescription: NWR - person tested positive to Covid 19 in camp
FullDescription: Person tested positive to Covid 19 in camp.  Required to isolate for at least five days.
ImmediateAction: Required to isolate for at least five days.

ShortDescription: IP tested positive for COVID-19. Symptomatic.
FullDescription: Presented to PEC with symptoms, tested Antigen positive. Sent home for self-isolation and will be checked after 3 days
ImmediateAction: Sent home for self-isolation and will be checked after 3 days.

ShortDescription: IP tested positive for COVID-19 when conducting test to travel
FullDescription: Presented to PEC for PCR test for travel; tested PCR positive. Sent home for self-isolation and will be checked after 3 days
ImmediateAction: IP was put in isolation, was given meds and will be checked in 3 days.

ShortDescription: Person tested positive to Covid 19 in camp
FullDescription: Person tested positive to Covid 19 in camp.  Required to isolate for at least five days.
ImmediateAction: Required to isolate for at least five days

ShortDescription: CP-2022-0093 PD Scott Steel; knuckle boom contacted wall
FullDescription: Operator was skimming 2-3 inches of dirt off the ground inside the truck wash and the top of the knuckle made contact with the wall panel resulting in minor damage.
ImmediateAction: Work stopped, scene frozen, supervisor and Wood HSSE contacted. Canadian model followed and investigation initiated.

ShortDescription: Between 17:30hrs on 3/11/22 and 07:30hrs on 4/11/22 approx. 6 aluminum trackway panels were stolen and a tractor ignition damaged.
FullDescription: at 07:30hrs on the 04/11/22 the Wood OHL team arrived to tower AE63 worksite, to find approximately 6 Aluminum access trackway panels had been stolen, & the Wood Plant tractor ignition had been damaged -and left running. as part of the theft a sign had been left behind by the theft party from the vehicle that was used in the theft. When the phone number on the sign was phoned, the building company it belonged to said they had a Transit crew cab pick-up stolen the night before (see attached photographs of the sign & Site). The location is difficult to see from the main road and was not noticed by the subcontract security company undertaking mobile patrols on Wood's behalf.
ImmediateAction: The Tractor was isolated, Wood management were informed. Sunbelt Trackway informed. Police were contacted and will call back with a crime number. Wood is going to bolster the security at this location with an additional Static security guard and groundhog type welfare unit.
WorkActivities: No work activity being carried out at the time of the incident

ShortDescription: A fire fighting pipe was damage while performing drilling activity.
FullDescription: On 04/11/2022 at 16.30 while Zublin (Strabag subcontractor) was drilling for the Berlinez wall on IPDHT project, a firefighting pipe (1.5meters underground), was damaged.
ImmediateAction: The Petrom operation at RC2 (permit issuer) and FALK services (Petrom emergency service provider) were informed about the incident. With the help of FALK personnel, the water pipe was isolated. The area was secured by Strabag personnel in order to start the reparation of the pipe next day.

ShortDescription: Collision during commute home from site
FullDescription: IP had left site to make journey home for weekend, they had approached the Bowhouse roundabout at Kilmarnock and came to a stop, while waiting in the queueing traffic a Vauxhall Movano travelling in same direction failed to stop resulting in vehicle striking the rear of the IP vehicle.
ImmediateAction: Vehicle was driven to a safe point at side of the road where the appropriate details were given by the other driver. IP was checked out at Ayr Hospital on November 5th

ShortDescription: One Wood employee was detected as positive while in the hotel waiting for embark.
FullDescription: One Wood employee was detected as positive while in the hotel waiting for embark.
ImmediateAction: Isolation and medical recommendation

ShortDescription: SDI employee stuck a test pile with the crew van.
FullDescription: SDI employee struck a test pile while driving on HHTX location. Damage was caused to the right front end of the crew van. The employee did not have a spotter at the time of the incident. No injuries were reported. SDI EE was sent to Xtreme MD for a post accident non dot drug/alcohol panel.
ImmediateAction: SDI took the employee for a post-accident drug panel. SDI site Management held a safety standown covering the use of a spotter and driving near piles. Wood HSE stated to SDI employees no one is allowed to drive vehicles in the pile area. All maintenance trucks will report to Wood HSE before entering pile area.

ShortDescription: Operative Strained Back, during Scaffolding Erection - Motional Movement resulted in muscle strain.
FullDescription: A Kaefer Scaffolding Operative was undertaking a Scaffolding Erection in Area DB of Olefins 6, During the Erection Process the Operative was working on the First Lift of a Scaffolding Structure, when the Operative bent down to pick up a Scaffolding Double Clip, the Operative felt a sudden pain to their lower back. The Operative was able to descend the Scaffolding Access Ladder, but was in excruciating pain, when attempting to walk. The Site Emergency Medical Contractor (Falck) was immediately contacted. Falck attended the Incident Location and performed an assessment of the Injured Person. Pain Relief was administered in the form of (Gas & Air). The IP was then escorted to their welfare facility, where arrangements were made for the Kaefer HSE Advisor to escort the IP to the Local Accident & Emergency Centre (James Cook Hospital) for a further precuationary assessment.
ImmediateAction: The IP attended the A&E, where a precautionary X-Ray was undertaken. The Doctors have identified the Injury as being muscle related and IP was administered 2 x Co-codamol as pain relief. Observations identified the IP's Mobility improved. The Operative was issued with a prescription for Co-codamol and released from A&E. The Investigation has commenced, inclusive of witness statement gathering, medical declarations and history, whilst also assessing the worksite and task. At present the initial investigation has identified that insignificant load was being manually handled and the cause of the Injury is believed to have been from a motional movement.

ShortDescription: Slip and fall on wet surface hall in Técnicas Reunidas (TR) Office building by a subcontractor employee
FullDescription: IP went out through a door to the hall of the TR offices, when slipping and falling to the ground when its surface was wet (it was scrubbed). The near miss incident took place in PMC INEOS (Gorbea building), Técnicas Reunidas Offices - project 1 DD9245B.There was no wet floor signal or identification, to identify that the floor was wet. The IP received a first assistance by the TR doctor. At the first moment, IP has small annoying due to the fall, but any injuries.
ImmediateAction: The employee communicates the incident and it was given help if the IP needed, but it was not necessary. IP was fine.From Wood, we contact TR to understand the causes of the incident, such because the wet surface hall was not signalling and to prevent similar events could happen again.

ShortDescription: 1 Subcontractor (Driver) of home office infected Covid-19
FullDescription: 1 Subcontractor (Driver) of home office infected Covid-19. IP was isolated at home for 5 days.
ImmediateAction: IP notified line manager and P&OIP undertaken home isolation for 5 days.Decontaminated the car

ShortDescription: Employee lost footing and strained/sprained back muscle.
FullDescription: Wood employee was entering the economizer through the 2ft-by-2ft man door. Upon entrance, employee lost his footing on dampers. Fell same level and landed on his left hip, back and leg.  Employee experienced discomfort in his back and leg and requested off site medical attention. Employee was evaluated and given a return to work.  B1 was chosen as the severity because the incident resulted in a first aid.  B2 was chosen because the incident could have resulted in lost time.
ImmediateAction: Safety stand down to cover incident with all. All jobs must be approved by safety and supervision before any work begins each day. Place plywood and secure plywood to eliminate uneven walking working surface inside economizer. JSA to reflect hazards with mitigations. Mitigations to be in place before work begins and verified by supervision.

ShortDescription: IP received a cut to the bridge of his nose
FullDescription: The IP was working on C2202 at height. The IP was on a fixed platform and was leaning over side to attempt to retrieve some ropes. The IP was positioned between the vessel and the backscratcher. As he turned his head he struck the frame of the backscratcher with his safety glasses. This caused the glasses to impact back into his nose and leave  a small cut on the bridge of his nose.The IP was wearing Bollie Viper safety glasses and a Petzl climbing helmet which has no peak.
ImmediateAction: The IP was treated by a first aider and a plaster was applied

ShortDescription: Wood EE was working from a scaffold and was exposed from a line break nearby.
FullDescription: At approximately 9:15 PM on 11-02-2022, A Wood Electrician was working from a scaffold 12 feet above ground level, and another contractor across from the Wood EE was permitted to do a line opening. Communication was made between crews and when the other contractor began to open the line, the Wood EE was exposed to an airborne gas, all work tasks was stopped, and the block operations, and Dow EMS, JVIC safety, Wood safety, Construction Management were all notified.  Potential - Employee exposed to airborne gas had minimal health effect, returned to work with no restrictions.
ImmediateAction: Wood EE was released from Dow EHSS, Wood EE was transported to offsite occupational med for further evaluation. EE was released with no restrictions and return to work as normal.

ShortDescription: The Discovery of less than a quart of fluids on the ground during jobsite visual inspection
FullDescription: At approximately 2:00pm on 11/02/2022, SWPPP supervision reported the discovery of less than a quart of fluids. The spill was discovered in small Block 1 near basin 1-5, where Subcontractor (Vision) is boring. The cause of the spill is unknown, no equipment near the discovered accidental area, was leaking fluids.  The leak was immediately noticed, and Environmental (SWPPP) was notified to begin cleaning procedures. The actual severity and potential rating were selected as an A1 due to minimal reversible environmental impact.
ImmediateAction: Environmental (SWPPP) was notified. Clean up procedures immediately took place. All contaminated soil was correctly picked up and disposed of into proper containments.

ShortDescription: A Wood EE injured his ankle and forehead when he tripped while walking out of a meter building.
FullDescription: On Wednesday, 11-2-2022, at approximately 12:00 pm, the Wood IP was tasked with removing the calibration card out of the meter building at the JDUF 12G-1498 location.  As he was exiting the building and stepped over the threshold, his left ankle rolled causing him to stumble forward into the side of the truck which was parked near the door.  His left ankle received a sprang and his left forehead received a small contusion from contacting the side of the truck.  Actual severity is B1 because the injuries only required first aid measures.  Potential severity is B1 because it is unlikely that the injuries would have required more than first aid measures.
ImmediateAction: Reported the incident to the HSSES Advisor.  Axiom was notified

ShortDescription: One Wood employee was tested positive while in the hotel waiting for embark.
FullDescription: One Wood employee was tested positive while in the hotel waiting for embark.
ImmediateAction: Isolation and medical recommendation.

ShortDescription: Two Wood employees were detected as positive during massive test offshore.
FullDescription: Two Wood employees were detected as positive during massive test offshore.
ImmediateAction: Isolation and medical recommendation.

ShortDescription: 4 Wood staffs infected Covid-19 (Cumulative during 1-2 Nov 22)
FullDescription: 4 Wood staffs infected Covid-19 (Cumulative during 1-2 Nov 22)
ImmediateAction: IP notified P&O and line manager. IP isolated at home for 5 days. WFH was enabled for IP who willing to WFH while under home isolation.

ShortDescription: Wood employee felt discomfort in lower back after trying to remove air hose from trailer basement.
FullDescription: Wood employee was trying to pull on a chicago fitting type air hose (4 to 6 LBS) in a basement space under the tool trailer where they are stored. Employee mistakenly grabbed of a roll of 480 VAC thick heavy cable (48 LBS) instead; jerked and pulled it and received instant pain due to the weight of cable and ergonomics. Employee rested in break area for 20-30 min and then notified GF. GF Notified HSE at 12:10. Employee received treatment by first aid means.  B1 was selected as the actual severity as this has been treated with first aid means.  B2 has been selected as the potential severity as this incident could result in a lost time injury under different circumstances.
ImmediateAction: All removal of material from the basement was halted until investigation completed and corrective actions put in place. Employee was put in contact with (Axiom), Wood's third-party provider via Telephone.  Employee was then evaluated at the clinic and release to full duty.

ShortDescription: Door Slammed shut catching fingers, due to the movement of the vessel.
FullDescription: On Tuesday 01st November 2022, at approximately 19:00hrs, a Wood electrical commissioning employee was within his recreational time between shift, and he was within the recreational area of the vessel. During this time the IP went to the toilet and due to the moment of the vessel the toilet door slammed shut on his right hand, catching his 3rd and 4th fingers. The impact caused damage to his nails along with bruising and swelling to his fingers. The IP reported to the offshore medic where his wounder was cleaned, and dressing was applied.  The IP has been placed on restricted duties as a result of his injuries. The IP is due to demobilize on Thu 03 November 20022.
ImmediateAction: IP received medical attention for his injuries. Incident communicated within the daily safety meetings. The movement of the vessel and hazards associated with doors is covered within the arrival's induction and orientation.

ShortDescription: 2 Staffs of EPC's contractor infected Covid-19
IncidentAssignedTo: Other Person (Will not count on Statistical Reporting)
FullDescription: 2 Staffs of contractors of EPC infected Covid-19. All cases are stable and under home isolation.
ImmediateAction: IPs were isolated from project site for 5 days. Close contact can continue working in project as normal by following Covid-19 precaution.

ShortDescription: Vehicle Collision - 3rd party vehicle collided with Wood employee when on way to a client meeting
FullDescription: Employee was East bound on the M8 in fast lane driving at the speed limit 50mph. As Wood employee passed St. James interchange, two cars were coming off the exit lane. As they both joined the motorway, the second car pulled out in to the lane of Wood Employee as he did not see Wood employee vehicle.  Speed of the third party car was 10mph approx. Wood employee was driving at 50mph at time of incident.
ImmediateAction: Pulled over, exchanged details, called 999 to confirm that we were OK to leave the scene and then left. then called insurance to report the incident

ShortDescription: 1 Wood employee tested positive for Covid-1
FullDescription: 1 Wood offshore based employee tested positive for covid19. IP is currently symptomatic.
ImmediateAction: The case was referred to the local government health team for coordination and recording. The IP currently on home isolation and now monitored by Wood OH team

ShortDescription: PD-Service truck made contact with light pole
FullDescription: Service truck PP118 was reversing in PWD area at HGCP and made contact with a light pole.  No personnel were injured and there was no damage to the truck.  The light pole has a small dent from the impact.
ImmediateAction: Driver taken for D & A testing.  Investigation commenced.

ShortDescription: Report of a permit to work being altered to add further information
FullDescription: Supervisor added information to a permit without communicating the addition to permit issuer & arranging field checker sign-off.
ImmediateAction: Work ceased & permit returned.Investigation underway.

ShortDescription: 2 staff was infected with COVID and currently on medical leave.
FullDescription: 2 staff was infected with COVID and currently on medical leave.
ImmediateAction: Both staff currently on isolation and on medical leave . Staff will only be allowed to return back to work once tested negative and has no symptoms.

ShortDescription: Open Fracture to left ring finger
FullDescription: While two employees were manually handling a Loffelstein concrete block, one employee lost his footing. While the employee attempted to regain his footing, the concrete block slipped and pinched the employee’s finger.
ImmediateAction: Incident reporting protocol was followed, and all work was stopped.Sasol emergency management services was summoned, and injured person was taken to the Sasol medical center.The scene was secured and barricaded.Preliminary investigation was initiated.

ShortDescription: A low bed Equipment transport truck damaged a gate frame when it turned left towards the main gate to the CPF from Condensate road
FullDescription: On the day of the incident, a low-bed truck driver had delivered machinery and equipment to the CPF IGF area and was on his way out of the area along Condensate Road. When the driver approached the intersection with the CPF Main Road he kept to the right of the road through the access gate to make a left turn towards the security exit. The driver proceeded through the gate turning left when the back panel of the low-bed truck hooked the frame of the access gate damaging the frame. The incident classification remains the same as this area is controlled by flagmen. the flagmen however were on the other side of the vehicle when it moved through the gate and could not stop the driver because he was not aware the tail section was too close to the gate
ImmediateAction: The scene was visited by both Wood and ENHL-Bonatti personnelThe incident was recorded in CAIRSInvestigation to be conducted 01 Nov 2022

ShortDescription: Piling rig impacted underground cable
FullDescription: At approximately 16:30 on Monday 31st October the piling team was tasked with piling an area within the DWX. The area had recently been excavated to establish underground services. All services were identified and therefore a piling sleeve was placed in the pile location prior to backfilling to ensure that the piling operation did not impact any existing services. During the piling the operator observed red concrete and immediately stopped piling. On closer inspection he identified piling was being conducted outside of the dedicated piling sleeve consequently impacting the live cable.
ImmediateAction: Piling operations stopped. Excavation to establish extent of damage undertaken. Area barried off for Client rectification of cable.

Project: US East - Oil & Gas - Gulf Coast
ShortDescription: Tree limb struck the side mirror of the Wood vehicle.
FullDescription: On October 31, 2022, at 3:00 pm, a EE was leaving site location in Brookhaven, MS when he stated that a tree limb struck the passenger side mirror on the Wood vehicle. Impact caused the side mirror to break off the vehicle. Actual (A1): Impact caused minor damage to vehicle; repairs not expected to exceed 10k. Potential (A1): Minor vehicle damage caused by a tree limb.
ImmediateAction: EE reported the incident to his account manager.

ShortDescription: Front end loader backed into a parked pickup truck.
FullDescription: At approximately 09:40 a subcontractor employee driving a subcontractor's Ford F250 pickup drove up and came to a stop behind a subcontractor's Caterpillar 930M loader as it was moving material. The loader operator reversed contacting the driver's side front door. The vehicle's driver was in the pickup truck when the incident occurred. The equipment and vehicle are owned and operated by the same subcontractor. The actual severity is rated a B1, no one was injured, and estimated damages are less than 10K. The potential severity is rated a B2 with a potential for a medical treatment case and vehicle damages exceeding 10K.
ImmediateAction: Worked was stopped. working to issue a 1st alert/

ShortDescription: 4 Wood staffs infected Covid-19. All cases are stable and under home isolation.
FullDescription: 4 Wood staffs infected Covid-19. All cases are stable and under home isolation.
ImmediateAction: IP notified to P&O and Line ManagerIP managed to seek doctor for medication support.IP isolated at home. WFH allowed for IP who willing to WFH after recovered.

ShortDescription: 1 employee tested positive for COVID
FullDescription: 1 Wood employee assigned in NMB tested positive in Covid19.
ImmediateAction: Self quarantine at home as per MOH procedures.

ShortDescription: Employee tested positive for Covid-19
FullDescription: Employee tested positive for Covid-19 on October 30, 2022
ImmediateAction: Employee will stay at home to work through 11/7/2022

ShortDescription: While on the way to work an employee struck a deer in the roadway causing damage to the front of the leased truck.
FullDescription: Employee was driving into the workplace in Hermiston, OR and a deer ran into the roadway in front of the employee's leased company vehicle.  The deer strike caused very light damage to the leased vehicle and the leased truck was drivable and the employee continued on to work after completing an inspection to determine road worthiness.  The employee was wearing their seatbelt and suffered no injuries and because of the safety features and height of the vehicle it is not probable that the employee could have been injured.
ImmediateAction: The employee conducted an inspection of the vehicle to determine that it was road worthy and continued onto the Hermiston office.

ShortDescription: Employee allegedly twisted knee when dismounting haul truck
FullDescription: On October 28, 2022 an employee wrote on his time card that he had twisted his right knee when dismounting his haul truck at the end of the shift.  He was feeling slight pain and some swelling.  He was not limping and had been observed walking normally at the end of the shift. The employee left the project office without telling anyone and then called in later to tell the supervisor he had been injured.
ImmediateAction: The employee was asked to return to the project on 10/29/2022 and was taken to the emergency room for an assessment.The doctor did not definitively diagnose an injury.  Ice and ibuprofen as needed was recommended.  If anything changes the employee was instructed to call the safety department to arrange further medical review

ShortDescription: CP-2022-0092 PD; Overturned Rigid Truck
FullDescription: A loaded 935 rigid truck was backing up an access ramp to dump area and while doing so, truck overturned. No injuries sustained.
ImmediateAction: Work stopped, scene frozen and supervisor contacted. Canadian Model followed. Incident Investigation initiated.

ShortDescription: CP-2022-0091 MTC BME; laceration right thumb from metal flashing
FullDescription: IP was cutting metal flashing with tin snipes when the wind caught a piece of the flashing which then made contact with the workers thumb and caused a laceration. IP was wearing gloves at the time of incident.
ImmediateAction: Work stopped and supervisor contacted. IP was taken to onsite PA who assessed, cleaned and applied sutures. Canadian Model was followed. IP returned to work. Incident Investigation initiated.

ShortDescription: Twisted/Sprained ankle, sustained whilst stepping on a kick plate.
FullDescription: On Fri 28th Oct 22 at approximately 22:50hrs an incident occurred, a Wood nightshift plater who was working beside the pig receiver on the PDR Lv 1. Whilst he was conducting his task the plater caught his foot on the kick plate in the area, which resulted in him twisting his foot causing slight discomfort.  The plater continued to work as he thought it was fine and would ease within time and that he hadn’t caused any long-term damage.  The IP decided at 03:00hrs on Sat 29th Oct to visit the nightshift medic as it was not easing.  The medic provided paracetamol, ibuprofen along with an ice pack and he was given the rest of the shift to rest, he was requested to see the day shift medic once he had awoken from his rest that day.  On review by the day shift medic the IP was deemed fit to return to work. Findings: The kick plate hazard paint had faded so it was not as visible as it should have been, lights were working fine, and the area was well illuminated.
ImmediateAction: The kick plate was Sprayed pink to highlight the trip hazard to make it more visible to personnel working in this area. Incident shared to al personnel during safety meetings, TBT to highlight trip hazards and situational awareness.

ShortDescription: IP collapsed (fell unconscious) outside of the office in 3GI
FullDescription: Non-work related: 28th of November, approx. 12.05 pm IP collapsed (fell unconscious) while walking in the 3GI DP-24 area, he was put into the recovery position by a colleauge. Emergency Service #5555 was immediately informed by the E&I technician and an ambulance was on site within minutes, but at which time IP was coming round. IP was transferred to TCOV Clinic.
ImmediateAction: WoodKSS and TCO Management have been notified. IP has been seen by the Doctor at the TCOV clinic, and IP is feeling ok at the moment, the Doctor has advised he goes to his home city of Atyrau for further medical checks.

ShortDescription: Person tested positive to Covid in 19 camp
FullDescription: Person tested positive to Covid 19 in camp.  Required to isolate in camp for 5 days.
ImmediateAction: Isolate in camp for 5 days

ShortDescription: Driver of a Light Vehicle (LV) reversed into a bollard
FullDescription: Driver of a light vehicle (LV) had pulled up next to the maintenance building to pick up some items.  Whilst leaving the area the driver had reversed into one of the newly installed bollards (used to delineate the spoon drain) outside the maintenance building.  This had resulted in the bollard being pushed over and minor damage to the left rear reflector on the LV’s tailgate.  The driver and passenger are safe.
ImmediateAction: D&A test completed; samples provided negative.

ShortDescription: 1 Wood staff infected Covid-19
FullDescription: 1 Wood staff infected Covid-19. IP has been isolating at home for 5 days.
ImmediateAction: Project site management and client were notified. IP went to see doctor then isolate at home for 5 days.

ShortDescription: 1 Wood staff infected Covid-19.
FullDescription: 1 Wood staff infected Covid-19. IP was isolated from office and under Home Isolation.
ImmediateAction: 1 Wood staff infected Covid-19. IP was isolated from office and under Home Isolation. IP is stable.

ShortDescription: 2 workers under EPC infected Covid-19
IncidentAssignedTo: Other Person (Will not count on Statistical Reporting)
FullDescription: 2 workers under client's EPC infected Covid-19. All of them had been under home isolation for 5 days. All of infected persons were stable.
ImmediateAction: All infected workers were isolated from project site for home isolation. Close contact tracing commenced. Close contact can work in project as per site protocol.

ShortDescription: 4 Wood staffs, 1 subcontractor infected Covid-19 (cumulative over the past week)
FullDescription: 4 Wood staffs, 1 subcontractor infected Covid-19 (cumulative over the past week). All of them were under home isolation. No one was in serious symptoms.
ImmediateAction: All infected person had been isolated from office or project site for home isolation. close contact commenced. work area was cleaned where necessary.

ShortDescription: Windy caused a FL door to swing open and break the glass.
FullDescription: SDI EE was exiting the FL when the wind caught the door and swung it open causing the door glass to break.
ImmediateAction: SDI reported the event to Wood HSSE and SDI Management. They discuss proper hand/grip placement when opening and closing doors to all equipment under windy conditions. They discussed it with each crew throughout the day and the next day during the JSA meeting.

ShortDescription: The Flap Disk broke during the grinding job hitting the employee coverall and falling at the sea.
FullDescription: On October 27th, while an employee was treating a handrail at the wellhead deck north side, the flap disc shattered and a piece of it hit the employee's coverall front side.The employee immediately stopped the job and called his immediate supervisor to report the incident. The flap discs from the same box were inspected and no deviation was identified. The flap discs expiration date is for January 2025.  The incident was only reported by team through the observation card client system. The actual is B1 with potential C1 considering that two workers could be reached.
ImmediateAction: Stop the Job and check about the disk expire date.

ShortDescription: IE was drilling screws in to make a shelf when some saw dust debris got into his eye.
FullDescription: At approximately 3:30p.m. the IE and another EE where tasked to put together some shelves that were going to be used in a connex to hold material. While the EE was cutting 2x4 plywood for the shelves the IE was drilling holes in the wood for the screws to go in. IE was standing about 7 to 10ft away from the EE when debris got into his eye. IE was wearing safety glasses. Potential - Employee received first aid, unlikely it would be a more severe injury.
ImmediateAction: IE informed his Foreman who then contacted HSSE with the issue. The IE was then taken to an offsite medical facility. Client Ops HSSE informed, Wood Management Team notified.

ShortDescription: Wood Electrical Engineer received arc flash burns to his face, hands and neck, after probing a switch with a rod within a live breaker.
FullDescription: Wood Electrical Engineer was performing a routine maintenance operation on one of the breakers in the switch room. The task required the removal of the breaker from the cabinet. The PTW and risk assessments were in place for the task and all required approvals for the routine PM were in place. The task was discussed, tag numbers checked and confirmed. The Engineer was aware that the breaker had been in closed position and without load. The Engineer then proceeded to start the task. Before removing the breaker, the it had to be switched off. The switch on the breaker failed to operate on 2-3 attempts. The IP, having had previous experience of failed switches, proceeded to open the cabinet, and remove the cover of the breaker, in order to gain the access to the switch and probe it with the screwdriver to release the switch mechanism. At this point, an arc flash occurred resulting in multiple 1st and 2nd degree burns to the IPs face, hands, neck, and the top of the head. It was subsequently identified that a steel rod was used by the Engineer.
ImmediateAction: All similar works have been suspended by the client until lessons learned have been derived from this investigation Client has instigated a check of all similar breakers for possible faults.

ShortDescription: Hard barricade with safety net collapsed at former drum storage area. There were no injuries or property damage recorded/observed.
FullDescription: Hard barricade and safety nets were provided for the hacking work activity to control flying concreteparticles and to prevent unauthorized entry to work area. On 27th Oct around 0805hrs, LnL supervisor, Kannan M. observed that the barricade in 35 Shipyard Road at former drum storage area had collapsed together with the safety nets that was secured to the hard barricade. The barricade fell inwards, towards the work location. There was no permit issued thus no work was going on and no one was nearby. Barricades were re-instated back immediately
ImmediateAction: 1.The barricades were re-instated immediately. 2.All nettings shall be removed after hacking work by sections.3.Future screening will be replaced with canvas instead of netting. The canvas will be cut with “V” shape to allow air to pass through.

ShortDescription: IP rfelt ill, was tested positive for covid
FullDescription: IP was not feeling well, suspected Malaria. Malaria test was negative, but then tested for covid, and was determined positive. He had slight headache, slight fever, so classed as symptomatic by the onsite Dr.
ImmediateAction: IP was placed in isolation on the Chevron campus once Covid was confirmed. The Dr. says the IP is feeling fine today with slight symptoms. He will remain in isolation for 5 days

ShortDescription: One Wood employee was tested positive for COVID during the massive test offshore
FullDescription: One Wood employee was tested positive for COVID during the massive test offshore
ImmediateAction: Isolation and Medical recommendation.

ShortDescription: A scaffold labourer knocked head upon an erected horizontal scaffolding tube.
FullDescription: Scaffold labourer stooped under an erected horizontal bracing tubes on the scaffold to erect a plastic red/white chained barrier, on his way back he misjudged the height / location of the horizontal bracing tube as he stooped under it and banged the hardhat that he was wearing, against it.
ImmediateAction: Individual left the area due to pain in back of neck and returned to the project welfare village.Under guidance from Kaefer HSE Advisor he returned to the Olefins 6 Control Room and reported the incident to Sabic Falck (Site Emergency/ Medical Team) were called to attend and completed medical assessments upon the individual.Individual was given all clear to return to work.

Office: Wood Office  Northshore One, Northshore Road
ShortDescription: Security scare for member of staff and main lights not working in main car park
FullDescription: Staff member left the office Thursday 27th October and made her way to the main car park which is a short distance form the main office. She was using her mobile phone as a torch as the lights were not working in the main carpark due to cable theft. When she got to the barriers at the entrance to the car park, a man’s voice which appeared to be coming from the direction of the wooded area opposite (I couldn’t see anybody) shouted over “Hey you I’m over here.  Hey you I’m talking to you…I’m over here”.She pretended she had a call coming through and they were about to arrive shortly in the car park she managed to get to her vehicle and immediately locked all the main doors and left the car park as quickly as she could.  She did not see anybody on the side road but she was shaken up by the episode.
ImmediateAction: Reported to landlord/Building manager and requested immediate repairs to lightsI have had confirmation from the landlord  that repairs to the car park lights will be carried out on morning of 31st October by Ashley Judd.  Have question how landlord we prevent reoccurrence and possibility of CCTV in car park.

ShortDescription: IP sustained a muscular strain to their left shoulder while working on a poly pipe
FullDescription: On Wednesday 26 October at 14:00, the IP was working on a poly pipe at North Pine WTP where they sustained a muscular strain to their left shoulder.
ImmediateAction: IP notified HSEQ Partner and Supervisor (Mechanical Leading Hand) and went to the Medical centre for a check-up

ShortDescription: During setup of welding equipment, an electrical arc was observed by the team when attempting to attach grounding.
FullDescription: During setup of welding equipment within a habitat, an electrical arc was observed by the team at the base of an argon cylinder, located outside the habitat, when attempting to attach grounding clamp. There is no evidence to suggest injury could have occurred to personnel, as no one was in the vicinity of cylinder which was properly secured via scaffolding and binding straps in preparation for welding activities.
ImmediateAction: All systems were shut down as per hot work procedure, and site management and HSSE informed. Preliminary investigation launched on platform to ascertain the root cause of same.

ShortDescription: Office staff member suffered chest pains
FullDescription: IP was experiencing chest pain
ImmediateAction: IP was rushed to British Medical Center in Mangaf. The consulting doctor said reports were fine however IP will need to rest for a few days.

ShortDescription: IP's right hand made contact into the side corner of the incoming/outgoing document tray resulting to laceration.
FullDescription: While cleaning her workstation, IP's right hand made contact into the side corner of the incoming/outgoing document tray resulting to a minor laceration on her ring finger.
ImmediateAction: IP stops work and went to the office clinic for treatment.

ShortDescription: Wood vehicle struck the back end of a 3rd party vehicle as he was driving to his next location.
FullDescription: On October 25, 2022, at 1:00 pm, a Wood EE was en route to location in Mentone, TX when the Wood vehicle struck the back end of a 3rd party vehicle as the 3rd party driver was stopped at a speed bump. Dust in the air caused poor visibility for the Wood driver which made it difficult for him to see the 3rd party driver’s taillight. Impact caused damage to the front end of the Wood vehicle. Actual (A1): Damage expected to be less than 10k; Potential (A1): no major impact.
ImmediateAction: EE reported the incident to his Wood manager.

ShortDescription: Unsecured Angle Iron fell from its position through a grating opening between the pipe and kick-plate the lower floor
FullDescription: Whilst a Masedi employee was strapping cables on the scale floor, the cable runner on which he was strapping the cable to was not properly secured and fell. The runner was a 40mm x 40mm x 300mm angle iron, the angle iron fell from its position through a grating opening between the pipe and kick-plate and onto the lower vastrap flooring which is approximately +- 4m below (firing floor).
ImmediateAction: All project activities were stopped, and employees moved to the contractor laydown area - Wood Safety stand-down was conducted on the incident (dropped objects and the importance of reporting near missed) with all project employees -     Wood The control room was notified of the near miss. Preliminary investigation was conducted.

ShortDescription: One Wood employee was detected as positive for Covid while in the hotel waiting for embark.
FullDescription: One Wood employee was detected as positive for Covid while in the hotel waiting for embark.
ImmediateAction: Isolation and medical recommendation.

ShortDescription: One Wood employee was tested at home for COVID.
FullDescription: One Wood employee was tested at home for COVID.
ImmediateAction: Isolation and medical Recommendation.

ShortDescription: The employee had its arm pressed between the coil and the guardrail, after trying to manually centralize the load
FullDescription: Around 03:00pm on October 24, 2022, during maneuver to adjust the steel cable reels with the aid of hoist equipment (hoist, strap and guide cable) to service the maintenance of lifeboat 03, the employee had its arm pressed between the coil and the guardrail, after trying to manually centralize the load (cargo load 200 KG). The actual and potential B2 was chose due the consequence and the way of treatment as restrict word.
ImmediateAction: Performed medical care, prescribe medication and cold compress on site.

ShortDescription: Employee tested positive for COVID19
FullDescription: Maintenance technician tested positive and advised Ops Mgr that he would be unavailable for work
ImmediateAction: Isolation at home

ShortDescription: IP right thumb received a laceration from locking ear on block valve.
FullDescription: IP was closing a 2 inch block valve with their right hand by pulling the handle to close. The valve was horizontal. As the IP was pulling the handle towards them, their right thumb was cut by the locking ear on the valve body causing a 1/2 inch laceration. The IP stated he was wearing Mechanix gloves at the time. Medic cleaned, bandaged, and administered a tetanus shot. IP returned to work. Actual severity is A1 as the was only a minor cut requiring first aid measures. Potential is B2 due to the IP could have received a more severe laceration.
ImmediateAction: IP reported the incident to the medic, was treated and returned to work.

ShortDescription: IP caught earring on chain while delivering kitchen supplies
IncidentAssignedTo: Visitor (Will not count on Statistical Reporting)
FullDescription: IP from food supplier was delivering stock to the canteen. The canteen access door has chain mail to prevent insects that hang from the roof. The IP was wearing a hoop style earing. The IP had delivered 4 boxes of stock. As he left through the door his left ear which had a hoop style earing caught on the chain and ripped his earlobe. The IP reported and was treated by a site first aider. The IP did not want to be taken to hospital for treatment and advised he would attend himself.The site contacted the IPs employer to advise of the situation
ImmediateAction: A small dressing was applied and the IPs employer contacted
