FullDescription: In connection with rope work, a person suffered a strain/overload in the left arm when the person climbed up from the rope. He felt a stabbing/radiating pain from the back of his left shoulder down past his elbow. The person went to the nurse for a further check of the arm/shoulder. The person involved states that pain in the arm/shoulder is known and has occurred in the past (old injury).
ImmediateAction: The person went to the nurse the same day 08.10.2022 for a check-up when he experienced stabbing/radiating pain from the back of his left shoulder down past the elbow.Person was sent ashore for further arm/shoulder check on 09.10.2022, came out again on 11.10.2022 and is back at work again.

ShortDescription: A ENHL-Bonatti employee's hand got pinched between two steel concrete shutter panels resulting in an injury
FullDescription: On the day of the incident at approximately 16h01 PM, an ENHL-Bonatti employee performed manual handling of shutters with a team of three colleagues from the area where they were offloaded to the area where they needed to be installed to cast concrete over an existing line. When the shutter was being picked up, the IP's hand got pinched between the shutter being picked up and a shutter below. ?	The IP started on the project on the 12th of September 2022 and has been with ENHL-Bonatti for a year.?	The IP is a general labourer and was asked to assist another supervisor with moving of the shutter board, which is within the scope of work for a general labourer.?	The incident was only reported on the 9th October 2022 to Wood.?	The IP was not seen by the on-site Client appointed medical staff (Paramedics)?	The IP was not scheduled to work on the 9th October 2022 and was therefore not at work on the 9th October 2022?	The IP was not wearing impact rated gloves when performing this workThe IP was taken off site to the ENHL-Bonatti medical facility where he was treated by the ENHL-Bonatti medical personnel and the incident classified as a first-aid case
ImmediateAction: ?	The IP was given first aid on site by the appointed first aider?	IP was taken to the ENHL-Bonatti medical facility and given treatment.?	ENHL-Bonatti leadership were informed of the incident?	ENHL-Bonatti leadership were tasked to investigate the causes of incident. Wood and Client to be involved and invited?	Incident reporting protocols to be added to the stand down agenda planned for the 11th October 2022

ShortDescription: Team discovered section of Ankormat matting had been cut and stolen(~20sq.m) overnight at RoW KP64
FullDescription: Wood, EM & visitors arrived on site for site visit at KP64 RoW.Team discovered section of Ankormat matting had been cut and stolen(~20sq.m), overnight from KP64
ImmediateAction: EM security informed, investigation underway.
WorkActivities: No work activity being carried out at the time of the incident

ShortDescription: Left Thumb caught in between grating panel
FullDescription: on 07th Oct 2022, approximately at 11:15am, one blasting & painting personnel was doing painting works on the CPCF07 landing platform of the first caged ladder going up to Flare stack. Whilst performing his task, he tried to lift a grating panel to have full access to his paintbrush when suddenly the grating slid down and lose control causing his left thumb to get caught in between.
ImmediateAction: The OCM & CSR was informed. IP immediately brought to BTT clinic by his supervisor for a medical assessment. BTT medic consulted PHC and advised to be demobilize and be brought to the hospital for further medical treatment following the case management process.

ShortDescription: Mechanic received small laceration from bolt head
FullDescription: On October 7, 2022 at 1245 the mechanic was removing a cutting edge bolt from a Volvo 220 loader.  The injured person was wearing Samurai Tuffalene Platinum Cut Resistant gloves at the time of the incident.  The head of the bolt was worn so it had a sharp edge.  When the bolt spun, as it was being removed, the bolt head sliced through the glove and into the left lower outside skin of the index finger lower knuckle.  The resulting laceration was approximately 3/4" in length and approximately 1/8" deep.
ImmediateAction: General first aid was administered to the affected area and the employee was observed for 15 min before releasing back to work

ShortDescription: IP sustained minor strain in lower back while shifting the centrifuge feed pump which was loaded to a trolley.
FullDescription: On Friday 7 October 2022 at 11:00am at Kilcoy Water Treatment Plant (WTP), IP felt a slight pull on lower back as they were getting ready to install centrifuge feed pump and shifting the load that was transported in a trolley.
ImmediateAction: IP had monitored back pain and was taken to the doctor for a check up.

ShortDescription: IP receives laceration to right middle finger
FullDescription: Employee scope of work was to lay 1-1/2" stainless steel flange on new expansion joint to verify that bolt holes align correctly. Loose flange was laid on forks of fork lift and placed over the top of the expansion joint. Employee used 36" pry bar to shift and align holes prior to laying flange completely flat on expansion joint flange. One side of the flange was touching and the opposite end was roughly on the edge of the forks being lowered and removed from forks. At this time the employee shifted the flange with his left hand in the line of fire causing the flange to slip from the fork and fall onto left finger. Employee removed finger from between flanges and went to the superintendent. Superintendent took employee to the tool trailer and began wrapping affected area with gauze to secure the wound. At this time the safety representative was contacted and arrived at the tool trailer. He also assisted with the first aid and began compiling incident reports and witness statements.
ImmediateAction: IP's injury was cleaned, dressed and bandaged.  Wood HSSE was notified and OccuCare was called.  OccuCare medical personnel advised first aid measures with OTC ibuprofen as needed.

ShortDescription: Contractor employee tested positive for COVID-19 whilst offshore
FullDescription: Contractor employee tested positive for COVID-19 whilst offshore
ImmediateAction: IP is isolating offshore while waiting for a flight.

ShortDescription: Wood employee tested positive for COVID-19 whilst offshore
FullDescription: Wood employee tested positive for COVID-19 whilst offshore
ImmediateAction: IP is isolating offshore while waiting for a flight.

ShortDescription: An employee tested positive to COVID-19.
FullDescription: After developing compatible symptoms an employee took a rapid test resulting positive. Employee notified a close contact with another colleague in the office. Identified close contact was notified and more restrictive COVID-19 protocol was applied to him.
ImmediateAction: Preventive quarantine with remote working for positive personnel. Company doctor follow up. Close contact tracing. Increased COVID-19 preventive protocol applied to close contact.

ShortDescription: Subcontractor (Nacap Employee) bumped their right knee on a lower door latch when exiting the first floor of the RSCC building.
FullDescription: Subcontractor (Nacap Employee) bumped their right knee on a lower door latch when exiting the first floor of the RSCC building.
ImmediateAction: IP was taken to the Angore site Doctor for assessment

ShortDescription: IP was walking the corridor when their shoe slipped off their foot causing them to bang their right hip against the door frame
FullDescription: IP was walking the corridor when their shoe slipped off their foot causing them to bang their right hip against the door frame
ImmediateAction: IP reported it into line manager and HSSE due to feeling pain when walking.

ShortDescription: 250T crane had alarm at the hydraulic system while lifting electrical cables.
FullDescription: Around 09:00, while the 250T crane was lifting some electrical cables at a height of 75m, an alarm was activated on the crane's hydraulic system. This led to a sudden movement of the crane's boom. Crane operator move the boom of the crane 90° south to avoid the load stay on top of the coke drums. In addition, while the operator was trying to lower the load, the crane motor stopped working and the load was suspended at 75 metres.
ImmediateAction: The crane operator positioned the crane boom approximately 90 degrees to the south to place the load in a safe position and avoid the load stay on top of the coke drums. (fenced area and closed to the passage of persons) Crane mechanic was called. The load was lowered. Additional investigations are being carried out.

ShortDescription: IP felt slight strain in a back muscle
FullDescription: IP felt minor strain in the back while accessing a scaffolding structure to undertake metering planned maintenance tasks. The IP reported the incident to his supervisor, no treatment was required, and the IP returned to work with no further issues reported.
ImmediateAction: IP stopped work and reported the strain immediately to his supervisor. IP did not require any treatment and returned to work with no further action / follow up required

ShortDescription: 1 Wood employee tested positive for Covid-19.
FullDescription: 1 Wood office based employee tested positive for covid19. IP is currently symptomatic
ImmediateAction: The case was referred to the local government health team for coordination and recording. The IP currently on home isolation and now monitored by Wood OH team

ShortDescription: The pile driving machine damaged underground instrument cables while boring pile at depth 1.7 meters. Nobody got injury.
FullDescription: At approximately 04.00 PM, Pile Driving Machine (Bore Pile) was drilling pile no. 25 at GOHF 3 area (Compressor foundation area). The Pile Driving machine was drilling (sizing 600 mm of pile dia.) at approx. 1.70 meters depth, the operator noticed the drill caught something underneath. The operator stopped and retracted the drill from the hole and found 2 pieces of cables. The operator reported to Contractor Supervisor and Wood Civil Supervisor & Wood HSSE Supervisor & EM Civil Supervisor at the incident location. The activity was stopped and informed to all persons involved (Wood HSSE Manager / Wood Construction Manager / EM Construction Manager / EM SSHE Lead). The incident area was barricaded and all of work crew was informed to keep away from the location. There were no injuries from this incident, only asset damaged.
ImmediateAction: -Barricaded incident area and post warning sign. -Informed all of persons involve (Wood HSSE Manager / Wood Construction Manager / EM Construction Manager / EM SSHE Lead  / Contractor CM) and informed to Wood Management at HO after went out from Refinery area.-Stopped all activities of Piling activity.-EM Electrical team checked the incident area.-Incident investigation commenced today from 17.00-18.00 hrs. (Wood & EM & Contractor involved in this investigation). D95

ShortDescription: 10 Wood staffs and 1 Subcontractor infected Covid-19 (Cumulative over the past week)
FullDescription: 10 Wood staffs and 1 Subcontractor infected Covid-19 (Cumulative over the past week). No one was in serious condition. All cases were on home isolation and return to work after 10 days Home Isolation.
ImmediateAction: Infected staffs were isolated from office. Tracing close contact. Office disinfection (where necessary). WFH was allowed for asymptomatic staffs and if they willing to WFH while undertake home isolation.

ShortDescription: Wood employee tested Antigen Rapid Test (ART) positive at an external Clinic.
FullDescription: Wood employee was not feeling well and went to clinic, where Antigen Rapid Test (ART) was conducted. The test result was positive. He was given 5 days medical leave as per MOH protocol.
ImmediateAction: Self-isolation to be carried out at his residence as per MOH guidelines. Disinfection was carried at his desk.

ShortDescription: A Wood IP when moving the generator room, suffered excoriations on the left knee, due to the sinking of the local floor.
FullDescription: On October 05th, at 21:46 pm, the employee Darlan Araujo de Jesus, Ballast Control Operator, when moving in the generator room, had a slight excoriation on the left knee, due to the sinking of the floor of the place at the time of the employee’s displacement.The employee went to the medical care, prescribe OTC medication and cold compress on site and returned to work.The actual and potential B1 was chose due the consequence and the way of treatment as first aid.
ImmediateAction: The employee went to the medical care, prescribe medication and cold compress on site and returned to work.
HazardSource: Electricity,Floor/Ground condition,Ladder,Moving parts of machinery,Stairs/Steps,Static equipment/machinery,Structure,Workstation layout

ShortDescription: 3rd party vehicle struck a parked Wood vehicle and drove away.
FullDescription: On October 5, 2022 around 4:17 am, Wood EE’s truck was parked at his camper trailer in an RV park in Orla, TX. EE woke up the next morning and noticed that someone struck the front of his vehicle and drove away. Impact caused damage to the front passenger side of the Wood vehicle. Actual (A1): repairs not expected to cost over 10k; Potential (A1): Wood vehicle was parked
ImmediateAction: Wood EE notified his account manager and filed a police report.

ShortDescription: 2 VDN Field employees were driving back from Fedex to site when another driver struck their vehicle - both employees uninjured
FullDescription: At approx 15:00 pm on Wednesday, October 15th 2 VDN Field analysts drove their rental vehicle (2021 Jeep Compass) to the FedEx location at 2000 Halverson Dr. Moon Twp. PA 15108 to pick up equipment for testing they were doing for Shell. Analyst 1 was driving while analyst 2 was in the passenger seat.  While driving, analyst 1 was stopped in the left turn lane from International Drive onto highway 376. His car was at a standstill position with his left turn lights on when a driver of a Hyundai Veloster made a very sharp left turn from highway 376 (WB) off-ramp and impacted the rental vehicle, mostly damaging the drivers front side. Both vehicles were towed at the scene and neither party was injured.
ImmediateAction: VDN analysts called the police immediately who arrived on scene within 5 minutes. Police took details from both parties and both cars were then towed to Jerry's Auto Wreck. Analysts then called their 2 coworkers who were still at the client's location that were able to come and pick them up safely. Once reaching the office, the incident was reported to their Manager and HSE.

ShortDescription: Contractor employee tested positive for COVID-19 whilst offshore
FullDescription: Contractor employee tested positive for COVID-19 whilst offshore
ImmediateAction: IP is isolating offshore while waiting for a flight.

ShortDescription: Employee was waling with client for observation, when he unknowingly approached a wasp nest and distrupted them causing one to sting him
FullDescription: The employee was walking around with the client team when he approached a wasp nest and one of the wasps stung him through his right sleeve.
ImmediateAction: Employee was taken to the office where he was monitored and ointment was applied to reduce the mild swelling.

ShortDescription: Attempted assult by local HESL walk-in worker on Nacap operator
FullDescription: Nacap Hagglund operator was dropping off lunches at KP7 RoW Angore when a local HESL walk-in worker allegedly tried to assault the Hagguland operator.No physical contact occurred.
ImmediateAction: Incident reported to client security.Investigation underway.
WorkActivities: No work activity being carried out at the time of the incident

Project: US East - Oil & Gas - All Other Clients
ShortDescription: IP was assisting wireline personnel with moving A-Frame when he felt a sharp pain in his left calf muscle.
FullDescription: IP was assisting Wireline hands with moving the A-frame to set up for wireline operations on the next well. Ip was pushing on the A-frame when he felt a sharp pain in his left calf muscle. IP stopped the movement. Actual A1- No treatment of injury received. Potential B1- Possible first aid needed for health effect.
ImmediateAction: IP reported the incident to the Platform PIC and no treatment or OTC medications were administered. IP is reporting minor muscle soreness to the left calf but requesting to remain working on location. Late notification of incident was made the following day to the Renaissance Offshore Supervisor 10-06-22 and Renaissance HSE and Wood Management received the initial report of notification this morning 10-09-22. Wood HSE Manager and Account Manager will conduct Initial Investigation and follow-up with Renaissance. Witness Statements and Job Safety Analysis has been requested.

ShortDescription: Valve assembly failed during pressure test.
IncidentAssignedTo: Other Person (Will not count on Statistical Reporting)
FullDescription: Client operations team  (2 client & 1 Wood seconded employee) were in the process of completing a pressure test of the high pressure (HP) manifold. The operations team completed closing the upper diverter valve on B16-63 when the valve handle / gear box cap (which weighs approximately 27 kg) separated and travelled a distance of 13 feet and made contact with the platform structure. The system pressure was approx 220 bar at the time.  This is classed as a B1 First Aid although there were no injuries or damage to Wood property.  Potential is assessed as B5 Fatality as the workers were in the line of fire when the assembly failed
ImmediateAction: All work suspended.

ShortDescription: One Wood employee complained about discomfort at the left eye after waking up.
FullDescription: The Wood employee was working as fire watch at the lower level where was happening the pipe fitting activities.  During the day the IP was worked normally without any complains.  In the morning while  just after waked up the IP realized bout the left eye showing discomfort and irritation. The IP was moved to offshore medical facility and the Doctor did not found anything, apply showers the eyes and release the IP to back to work. The leadership offshore decided to disembark the employee to be assessed by specialist. The specialist found a foreign body at the left eye(cornea), removing the foreign body and apply occlusive tampon until the day after when was reassessed.   After the tampom was removed the IP was released to back to work normally. The actual was initially considered B1 as first aid due the offshore information but becomes B2 due the treatments by specialist removing the foreign body with needle, and  the potential is B2 too.
ImmediateAction: Eye wash and disembark to be deeply assessed.

ShortDescription: Employees were pre-drilling holes for piles when a hydraulic hose ruptured causing a fluid spill.
FullDescription: Sub-contract employees were pre-drilling holes for piles when a hydraulic hose ruptured causing a spill. The equipment being operated was a Comacchio Hi-Tech MCH drill rig. The hydraulic hose had been rubbing on a piece of the equipment's frame which caused the rupture. The hydraulic leak occurred twenty feet away from personnel working in the area. Approximately four gallons (15.14 liters) of hydraulic fluid leaked onto the ground and was contained with a spill kit. Both the potential and the actual were selected as A-1 as there was no personnel at risk in the incident.
ImmediateAction: A spill kit was immediately utilized to prevent the spread of the fluid. All contaminated ground was removed and bagged for environmental disposal. A service technician onsite removed the damaged hose and capped the connections to prevent further fluid loss. An investigation was initiated.

ShortDescription: Front windshield struck by rock from passing vehicle in oncoming lane of traffic.
FullDescription: On October 4, 2022, at approximately 10:00am a foreign object struck the windshield of a Wood owned pickup truck. The truck was being driven by an authorized Wood employee driver. The driver stated that the foreign object was cast from the highway surface by a vehicle passing in the oncoming lane of traffic. The driver was driving back to the project site after fueling at an offsite gas station. Upon hearing the object strike the windshield, the driver pulled off the highway at a safe location to inspect the vehicle and discovered the damage. The damage is located near the VIN plate on the driver side of the windshield. The actual damage is an A-1 as the damages are less than $500 dollars. The potential damage is also rated as an A-1 as estimated potential damage is also less than $500 dollars.
ImmediateAction: Incident reported

ShortDescription: Contractor employee tested positive for COVID-19 whilst offshore
FullDescription: Contractor employee tested positive for COVID-19 whilst offshore
ImmediateAction: IP's in isolation offshore awaiting flights onshore to continue recovery

ShortDescription: Two Wood employees tested positive for COVID-19 whilst offshore
FullDescription: Two Wood employees tested positive for COVID-19 whilst offshore
ImmediateAction: IP's in isolation offshore awaiting flights onshore to continue recovery

ShortDescription: A Wood employee twisted their knee while getting into a vehicle to commute to a field office.
FullDescription: On Tuesday, October 4, 2022, at 6:00 am, the IP was getting into unit 169 preparing to commute to the Atlas Carbon office in Gillette Wyoming.  The IP stepped into the vehicle with their right leg and turned to sit on the seat.  While turning with weight on the right leg, the IP twisted the knee causing minor discomfort.  The actual severity is B1 because the IP's injury resulted in an non-work related injury with minor health effect.  The potential severity is B1 because it is unlikely that the injury could have required more than first aid measures.
ImmediateAction: The IP reported the incident to the Senior HSSES Advisor.  Axiom was contacted.

ShortDescription: Injured person stepped on a rock - slightly twisted knee
FullDescription: Employee was carrying two (2) jugs of Diesel Exhaust Fluid (DEF) to put into equipment.  The ground was level , but rocky.  Employee stepped on a rock turning his foot and causing a pain in his right knee.  There was slight swelling and low pain when walking just below the inside of his right knee.
ImmediateAction: Employee continued to work until seen limping by another employee who then instructed him to report the incident to the safety department.Ice was applied by the HSSE department in the office on 20 minute intervals until employee felt he could walk without pain. First aid treatment only.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         10/5/2022 Employee reported to work and states his knee is without pain and he is able to work.

ShortDescription: CP-2022-0084 PD Moreau; Pump Tank Vessel tipped
FullDescription: Workers had pump tank vessel rigged to be hoisted. The vessel was elevated enough to allow rotation, but during rotation (3/4 rotated) one of four chockers fully parted which resulted in vessel tipping sideways. Area was barricaded at time of incident. No injuries sustained.
ImmediateAction: Work stopped and area stood down. Investigation initiated.

FullDescription: Person tested positive to covid 19 in camp.  Required to isolate for at least five days.
ImmediateAction: Isolate for at least five days

ShortDescription: On October 3, 2022 at approximately 0630 the Cat 740B articulating water truck backed up onto a berm and tipped the tank onto the left side
FullDescription: On October 3, 2022 at approximately 0630 the Cat 740B articulating water truck backed up onto a berm and tipped the tank onto the left side.  A small ramp had been started on the north end of the northwest ramp onto the ore pad.  The new ramp is approximately 75 long with a berm at the end of the ramp.  The water truck driver drove down the new ramp to water before realizing that the ramp was a dead end.  There was no barricade to prevent the water truck from entering the ramp.                                                                                                                               When attempting to back out of the new ramp area the truck driver did not have a clear visual of where to back up.  The right wheels of the water truck went up on a berm (~6 feet high) causing the water in the tank to shift to the left and tipping over the tank.  This also resulted in the cab having the left tire off the ground.
ImmediateAction: Stop work authority was used to write a JSA to plan retrieval of the truck and clean up of spilled hydraulic fluid.  The truck was removed to a safe location for evaluation.

ShortDescription: An employee tested positive to COVID-19.
FullDescription: An employee was notified by a family member about a positive COVID-19 test result and took a preventive test resulting positive as well. The employee didn’t have any close contact in the office with others.
ImmediateAction: Company doctor follow up. Activate preventive cuarantine and remote working.

ShortDescription: 2 Wood staff was infected with COVID-19.
FullDescription: 2 Wood staff was infected with COVID-19 and experiencing mild symptoms.
ImmediateAction: Staff was isolated and currently on medical leave.

ShortDescription: Subcontractor Employee Wrist Fracture
FullDescription: On the 2nd of October 2022 at approximately 12:40 pm a subcontractor (CDT - Centro de Desarrollo Tecnologico) employee (IP) sustained a left wrist fracture as a result of tripping over a pipe and falling over. The IP was undertaking final gas measurements for the day within the perimeter of the Module A Tanks at the Ecopetrol Castilla 2 Station, when he tripped over a pipe when crossing between lines in a congested area. The IP attempted to break his fall, resulting in impact to the left wrist. Subsequently, the IP was sent for medical evaluation on the day, where he was referred for further evaluation at another medical provider. The IP was assessed again today on the 3rd of October 2022 where a fracture to his left wrist was confirmed.
ImmediateAction: Moved the person to medical center for evaluation

ShortDescription: While the Wood team was closing out the overboard job , during the wrap the antifire canvas one welder hammer dropped at the lower floor.
FullDescription: During the close out job of repair of the body guard in the stairways, while the antifire canvas was wrapping by the team one hammer was dropped at the lower level floor, out of the barrier established at the preliminary risk assessment. No one was hit,  due the area below does not have considerable traffic, so A1as actual and C1 Potential due two employees was walking around the area and could be reached. The Drops Calculator considered the impact as slightly with impact of 10.39 J.
ImmediateAction: The team was gathered by supervisor and  time out for safety delivered.

FullDescription: IP was removing a bolt with an impact gun when IP felt a foreign body in left eye. Eye protection was worn at time of incident.
ImmediateAction: IP contacted supervisor and flushed out left eye. IP was taken to onsite PA who stained & assessed. No foreign body was found. IP returned to work. Incident Investigation initiated.

ShortDescription: IP felt discomfort in lower back after awkward positioning movement while completing work task
FullDescription: IP felt discomfort in lower back after awkward positioning movement while completing work task. This is classified as a First Aid (B1) with a potential if left untreated or not following medical advice to progress to a Restricted Work Case (B2)
ImmediateAction: IP visited health centre for lower back discomfort and treated with non-prescription medication at non-prescription strength. Advised on back health stretches

ShortDescription: Wood employee assigned in Shallow water platform tested positive for Covid19
FullDescription: A Wood employee tested positive for Covid19. The IP is currently asymptomatic and was sent home for self isolation and monitoring of our company OH team.

ShortDescription: Wood employee tested Antigen Rapid Test (ART) positive at an external Clinic.
FullDescription: Wood employee was not feeling well and went to clinic, where Antigen Rapid Test (ART) was conducted. The test result was positive. He was given 7 days medical leave as per MOH protocol.

FullDescription: NWR - person in camp tested positive to covid 19.  Required to isolate for at least five days.

FullDescription: 4 Employees tested positive for Covid-19

ShortDescription: IP (US expat) tested positive for COVID-19. Symptomatic.
FullDescription: IP was experiencing headache and fever after which they attended the Clinic on 27 September 2022 where they tested negative for COVID-19 and was prescribed medication and rest.  On 29 September the IP was still displaying symptoms after which they reported to the Clinic which yielded a positive COVID-19 result.
ImmediateAction: The IP was sent to their accommodation to isolate and rest for three days after which they would be required to return to the clinic for a follow up test / evaluation.  The Client no longer requires contact tracing (including the need to be tested), the need to wear masks or to conduct a sanitization of the office.  However, the office was sanitized and the other personnel in the office were advised to report any symptoms.  *NOTE: The IP was last in contact with other office personnel on the morning of 27 September 2022.

ShortDescription: FAC - 900mm scaffold tube dropped 770mm and contacts IP's back
FullDescription: FAC-While erecting scaffold at HGCP, a scaffolder dislodged a 900mm tube (4kg) with his hip from a 2.3m high deck which resulted in the tube falling 770mm to grade.  The tube made contact with the back of another scaffolder at ground level as it travelled down.
ImmediateAction: Job stopped, IP was taken to the site clinic for assessment and first aid was applied.  The IP was released back to full duties.

ShortDescription: Pickup ran over a burried rock - poked hole in transmission pan
FullDescription: While driving on the D-pit road the driver drove off the edge of an 18 inch dirt lift and struck a buried rock.  The rock rolled under the vehicle poking a hole in the transmission oil pan.
ImmediateAction: The driver immediately pulled over out of the path of the haul truck traffic. The pickup truck was removed from the area on a trailer.  A 2 gallon hydraulic fluid spill occurred which was immediately cleaned up with absorbent pads and treated with bio-remediation media (Ultimate RTU Max)

ShortDescription: P  was tightening bolt with wrench and socket when the wrench slipped striking IP on the left cheek below the eye
FullDescription: IP  was tightening bolt with wrench and socket when the wrench slipped striking IP on the left cheek below the eye resulting in a less than 1cm long laceration. This is classified as a First Aid (B1) with a potential if more significant to have required sutures leading to a Medical Treatment Case (B2)
ImmediateAction: IP attended medical centre for assessment, wound cleansed with saline and steri-strip and polysporin advised to keep area clean and apply ice for 15-20 minutes every 2-3 hours while awake.

ShortDescription: Light vehicle was  reversing past a parked Light vehicle when the corner of the moving vehicle came in contact with the rear of the parked L
FullDescription: Two light vehicles were parked in line at the rear of the mechanical workshop at Wynnum Gardens, vehicles 790GEN and 335GLJ. Two Wood employees entered the vehicle parked in front (790GEN) and commenced reversing the vehicle past 335GLJ. While looking at the passenger side mirror for obstruction and traffic, the driver did not notice how close he was to the other vehicle and as a result the back drivers corner on the tray contacted the rear passenger side tray on 335GLJ resulting in a scrap to the aluminum side gate on the vehicle. The vehicle was parked up and the incident reported to their supervisor.
ImmediateAction: Vehicle parked up and supervisor and HSE notified. Investigation underway

FullDescription: Person tested positive to covid 19 in camp.  Required to isolate for at least five days

ShortDescription: A 240 SGT employee tested positive for COVID-19.
FullDescription: A 240 SGT employee tested positive for COVID-19 whilst on vacation.

ShortDescription: IP (Filipino expat) was experiencing flu like symptoms, diagnosed with a respiratory infection.
FullDescription: The IP (Filipino expat) was experiencing flu like symptoms (body and head aches) and reported to the Clinic for evaluation.  IP was tested for COVID, Malaria and Typhoid all of which yielded negative results.
ImmediateAction: The IP was diagnosed to have a respiratory infection which is being treated with antibiotics. The IP is currently on bed rest and is to return to Clinic for follow up on 30 September for further evaluation and to be tested again for COVID, Malaria and Typhoid.

ShortDescription: Off-road articulating haul truck driver ran over a dirt chunk causing steering wheel to turn abruptly bruising operator's right hand.
FullDescription: As haul truck was traversing along the east haul route on the jobsite there was a chunk of clay that was along the edge of the haul road that the operator ran over.  This caused the articulating off-road truck's steering wheel to turn abruptly.  The operator having his right hand inside the steering wheel when it spun quickly allowing the spoke of the steering wheel to strike his hand causing it to be bruised.   The potential of this incident could have resulted in a worse injury, but not likely to cause a medical treatment severity due to the machine and its engineering steering dampening controls.
ImmediateAction: The employee reported the incident to his supervisor, and HSSE.  The employee was provided first aid measures and taken to Occ. Med. facility for X-rays and evaluation.  X-ray results were negative and employee was provided a full release to return back to work that day.  Employee was also provided a post accident D&A test that were negative.  Machine was immediately red tagged and taken out of service until maintenance department could verify safe to operate.

ShortDescription: While preforming an undercut excavator operator contacted future communication line support wire.
FullDescription: While preforming an undercut an excavator operator unintentionally contacted a future communication line support wire. The operator did not not see this lower line but did see the energized lines much higher on the pole. Due to the tension on this line when it was contacted it "whipped" upward and contacted the energized lines causing a breaker to trip.
ImmediateAction: Work was stopped and work area was secured. General contractor was notified along with power company and Kelchner HSSEA. Power company responded within 15 minutes and repaired the fuse on transformer. Operator was taken for post incident drug and alcohol test. Test was negative.

ShortDescription: Employee was on the third step of a step ladder pulling wire, IP attempted to turn to the side and heard a pop from the left knee.
FullDescription: IP was working in a tight congested area pulling wire working off a step ladder. The ladder was in between a wall and cable tray. The IP went to readjust himself on the step ladder and heard a pop in his left knee while twisting.
ImmediateAction: Site supervisor moved the IP to an airconditioned truck and called safety. The IP was given ibuprofen, ice pack was placed on the injury and he elevated his leg. Occucare was called.

ShortDescription: Wood employee complained of pain in right knee
FullDescription: During a morning inspection on site a wood employee complained about a recurring knee injury. Whilst back in the office the pain become intense and mobility was impacted. The IP remained in the office until transferred to local offsite emergency department for further assessment.
ImmediateAction: IP taken to local hospital by nominated floor leader for check-up. IP in contact with line manager.

ShortDescription: EI-Leak of 200ml Hydraulic fluid
FullDescription: Leak of approx 200ml hydraulic fluid from Cat 320 excavator (PP195) bucket hose coupling to grade (track).  The track comprises imported material.  Spill cleaned up and contaminated waste disposed of in correct waste container.  Note:  this is a different hose but on the same machine as the leak reported on 24th September.
ImmediateAction: Clean up spill, repair coupling on hose.

ShortDescription: One Wood employee was  complain with discomfort in the right eye cause by foreign body.
FullDescription: One Wood employee was working with a chemical substance at the base when felt a strange object in the right eye, caused by another employee who was grinding 5 meters far.The employee went to the hospital to remove the foreign object with cotton swab and returned to work without restriction. The actual and potential B1 was chose due the consequence and the way of treatment as first aid.
ImmediateAction: The IP was forwarded to the medical facilities to be assessed.

ShortDescription: Impactor jaw apron not blocked properly
FullDescription: On September 27, 2022 at approximately 1645 the maintenance personnel were cutting bolts off the wear plates on the Astec 4250 impact crusher in order to install new wear plates.  After cutting the bolts on the first plate the mechanic hit the bolt with a hammer to push it through.  The apron moved about 2 inches down, so the mechanic immediately moved out of the way.  He struck the apron again and it fell the remaining 17.5 inches to resting position.  If the employee had stayed with parts of his body beneath the wear plate he would have been caught between and caused an injury.
ImmediateAction: The maintenance operations were stopped and the situation was assessed.  The maintenance manual was referenced and it was found that a block needed to be in place under the top apron.  The task was continued on 9/28/22 with the proper blocking in place.

ShortDescription: Bed lock "ear" bent while lowering bed
FullDescription: On September 27, 2022 at approximately 1145 a shackle  with strap was attached to the bed lock retainer ear to help with holding the truck in place while dumping the bed to enable getting the Cat 777F haul truck unstuck.  When lowering the bed the shackle became wedged and bent the bed lock retainer ear.
ImmediateAction: The vendor maintenance department will check with manufacturer to determine if the ear can be heated and straightened out.   The bent ear does not interfere with operation of the truck or in locking the bed when in an up position.

Project: Safaniyah and Manifa Crude Increment Programs
ShortDescription: whilst carrying out an internal patrol security found SP2B Aramco secured client area propped open with a bin.
IncidentAssignedTo: Other Person (Will not count on Statistical Reporting)
FullDescription: whilst carrying out an internal patrol found SP2B Aramco secured client area propped open with a bin.
ImmediateAction: Security officer Stuart Lynch moved bin, secured the door and checked it was working correctly on swipereader and manually release button. No fault with reader or release button was found.
WorkActivities: No work activity being carried out at the time of the incident

ShortDescription: SIR - Skidsteer tampered with
FullDescription: SIR-Crew at KP64 arrived on site and noticed that the skidsteer had been tampered with by unknown persons and fuel had been syphoned.EM Security notified.
ImmediateAction: Exxon security notified.
WorkActivities: No work activity being carried out at the time of the incident

ShortDescription: A 240 SGT employee tested positive for COVID-19.
FullDescription: A 240 SGT employee tested positive for COVID-19 over the weekend.
ImmediateAction: Employee self-isolated.

ShortDescription: IP exited his excavator to assist pipe layer.  He lost balance and fell forward with his weight landing on his hands with wrist injuries.
FullDescription: IP was walking over to the trench box to aid the pipe layer and slipped next to the trench.  He fell forward landing on his hands in a push-up type position.  This caused pain to both left and right wrists.
ImmediateAction: HSSE and management was notified of the incident.  HSSE and management both reported to the scene to address the injured employee and see what happened.  Employee seemed to have sprained/strained both wrists.  IP initially wanted to take first aid measures and refused medical treatment.  As the shift went on it was determined that he would like to have X-rays per our recommendation.  Initial results from X-rays are that he has fractures of both wrists.

ShortDescription: Wood employee tested Antigen Rapid Test (ART) positive at an external Clinic.
FullDescription: Wood employee was not feeling well and went to clinic, where Antigen Rapid Test (ART) was conducted. The test result was positive. He was given medical leave
ImmediateAction: Self-isolation to be carried out at his residence as per MOH guidelines. He will carry out self- ART after 72 Hrs. To report to doctor if symptoms get severeOffice area has been disinfected

ShortDescription: NWR - person tested positive to Covid 19 in camp
FullDescription: Person tested positive to covid 19 in camp.  Required to isolate for at least five days.
ImmediateAction: Required to isolate for at least five days

ShortDescription: IP (EG National) tested positive for COVID-19. Symptomatic.
FullDescription: IP (EG National) was experiencing a fever and cough after which they reported to the medic where they were tested diagnosed positive for COVID-19.
ImmediateAction: IP will isolate in their room and will be tested again after 5 days.  Contact tracing was conducted which indicated one close contact, COVID test will be conducted in 5 days and this person will wear a face mask and practice social distancing until testing negative.

ShortDescription: EI-Leak of 20ml of bio oil to grade
FullDescription: Approx 20ml of bio oil leaked to grade from CAT 320 Excavator (PP195) from the tilt bucket hose.
ImmediateAction: The spill was cleaned up and contaminated waste was removed to the correct contaminated waste area.

ShortDescription: Volvo A45G haul truck backed into Volvo 950 excavator bucket
FullDescription: On September 23, 2022 at 1445 At Station 08 on the South Haul Road a property damage near miss occurred. A haul truck operator stated he was backing into the loading unit using his mirrors and camera.  He thought the bucket was in the air as is normal and was ready to load his truck.  However, the excavator bucket was actually on the ground and the operator out of the cab discussing the next digging plan with the dozer operator.  The center of the back bottom edge of the truck bed contacted the knuckle of the bucket ram.  There was only cosmetic damage to both pieces of equipment.
ImmediateAction: Both pieces of equipment were stopped in place and safety was called to investigate.  The haul truck operator was taken for a D/A screening.

ShortDescription: 1Wood employee tested positive for Covid-19.
FullDescription: 1 Wood office based employee tested positive for covid19. IP is currently symptomatic
ImmediateAction: The case was referred to the local government health team for coordination and recording. The IP was home isolation and now monitored by Wood OH team.  With two close contact.

ShortDescription: 10 Wood staffs and 1 Sub-contractor infected Covid-19 cumulative over the past week.
FullDescription: 10 Wood staff and 1 Sub-contractor infected Covid-19 cumulative over the past week. All IPs were isolated at home for home isolation.
ImmediateAction: An infected person was advised to isolate themselves at home and seek advice from a doctor. Work area.Close contact tracing commenced. Work area and common touch area cleaned. WFH allowed for staff who were willing to WFH after feeling better.

ShortDescription: One Wood employee was fell from the bunk while  was sleeping in the living quarter.
FullDescription: The Wood employee was sleeping at the cabin on board of PCE-1 when fallen from the bunk, the IP  was felling pain  at the chest  column area  and was disembarked at the day before to be assessed at the onshore medical facility. The sea condition was not contribute for the event.  The B1 actual  and potential classification was assumed due the height of fall and the IP condition.
ImmediateAction: The IP walking until the nursery and after first assessment was disembarked.

ShortDescription: Symptomatic Covid case NWR
FullDescription: IP reported positive for COVID after experiencing symptoms.
ImmediateAction: IP remains at home.

ShortDescription: E-7271Common Fuel Gas Heater 72-PSHH-707 failed to operate during PM.
FullDescription: During routine PM of SIL 1 pressure switch, the switch failed to activate. Switch function is to prevent fuel gas entering hot oil system following a tube rupture event. The switch type was Sirco switch, site has frequent failures or Sirco switches and ongoing investigation is ongoing in ATMS to investigate replacement of key Sirco switches.
ImmediateAction: Switch was removed and overhauled and is now functioning.Ongoing ATMS investigation currently active to explore the Sirco switches.

ShortDescription: IP (Filipino expat) was experiencing pain in the left knee. Tested positive for Malaria during admission to La Paz (asymptomatic).
FullDescription: IP was experiencing knee pain whilst offshore for approximately 4-5 days and sought treatment from the offshore medic which did not improve the condition (pain and swelling).  The IP was sent onshore for further treatment at La Paz where during admission the IP (who was asymptomatic) tested positive for Malaria.
ImmediateAction: The IP received treatment for malaria as well as the knee condition (debrided and antibiotics administered). The IP will remain at IBIS until fit to resume normal duties.  The TEGI Doctor will check in to monitor progress.IP was found fit to return to normal duties and will return offshore on 29 September 2022.

ShortDescription: A Wood employee pulled and strained a muscle in his upper abdominal area.
FullDescription: On Thursday, September 22, 2022, at approximately 1440, The IP was working on installing new rod pump packing. The IP I was using a 36" aluminum pipe wrench to try and line the packing gland up correctly. It was not moving so the IP gave one last try and felt a pulling/ripping feeling in my lower right diaphragm area. AXIOM was contacted and no medical treatment was deemed necessary. The Actual Severity is B1 because the injury affected one individual and did not result in First Aid. The Potential Severity is B1 because it is unlikely that the injury would have resulted in more than First Aid.
ImmediateAction: Contacted HSE

ShortDescription: IP presented with non work related personal illness
FullDescription: Checks were performed with PFA and onshore nurse. As a precautionary measure IP booked 0730 22nd September flight onshore. Meet and Great not required. Supervisor monitored IP post arrival onshore.
ImmediateAction: Checks performed with PFA and onshore nurse. As a precautionary measure IP booked 0730 22nd September flight onshore. Meet and Great was not required. Supervisor monitored IP post arrival onshore. No further actions required

ShortDescription: Ratchet wrench slipped from head of nut striking IP on left side of mouth
FullDescription: IP working  on HP Separator using a ratchet wrench wrench slipped from head of nut striking IP on left side of mouth resulting in a 1cm long laceration on bottom of lip and a superficial abrasion above the top lip. This is classified as a First Aid (B1) with a potential if more significant to have required sutures leading to a Medical Treatment Case (B2)
ImmediateAction: IP attended medical centre for assessment, wound cleansed with saline and steri-strip applied to laceration below lower lip. Superficial abrasion above upper lip did not require treatment

ShortDescription: One Wood employee tested positive for COVID during premobilization screening.
FullDescription: One Wood employee tested positive for COVID during premobilization screening. EE is asymptomatic and returned home for isolation. No contact tracing required.
ImmediateAction: EE instructed to return home for isolation.

ShortDescription: A Wood Janitorial employee tasked with cleaning the Frac building reported feeling discomfort to the lower back after emptying a mop bucket.
FullDescription: A WOOD janitorial employee was tasked with mopping the 300 Frac building. The task included filling the bucket with approximately 2 gallons of water and then emptying the bucket. Once the mopping was complete, the janitor lifted the bucket approximately 3’ from grade and emptied it into a utility sink and then returned the empty bucket to grade. The janitor reported feeling discomfort in the lower back Immediately after returning the bucket to grade. At 8:45am, the employee reported to their supervisor. Safety was notified and employee was evaluated by an occupational medical facility, where they were diagnosed with a muscle strain and released to return to work without restriction. Potential - Employee received first aid with the potential to have been more serious causing medical treatment to be needed.
ImmediateAction: Employee was taken to onsite medical and subsequently taken to offsite occupational medicine. Employee was evaluated by occupational medical facility, where they were diagnosed with a muscle strain and released to return to work without restriction.

ShortDescription: A Wood E&I employee operating a pick up truck backed into a stationary solar pile
FullDescription: On 09/21/2022, at approximately 1:10 pm, at Block 1 PCS 8 area, after completing the task employee started to proceed to the next location, employee noticed that the area in front was enclosed by red barricade due to excavating activities. Therefore, employee decided to back the truck to gain sufficient space to turn around and detour to a location where employee could complete the tasks.  The turnaround location was identified at block 1 near PCS 8. Driver began backing the truck between the array of two rows of solar piles until the truck was stopped by one of the piles. It was discovered that the left rear bumper of the truck made contact to a stationary solar pile located near PCS 8. The contact caused damage to the left rear bumper of the truck but no damage to the solar pile. No injury to personnel. The actual and potential ratings both listed as an A1 since the damage could not have resulted in more than 10k in damages.
ImmediateAction: The incident was reported to safety . Incident investigation protocols were put in place by the involved individual and HSSE. The JSA was closed, scene was frozen, photos of the incident/damage were collected. The employee was escorted to the safety office for statement and UA screening collection.

ShortDescription: Fire and smoke inside combiner box caused by reverse polarity on the string cable connection
FullDescription: On Monday, September 20, 2022, around 11:15am, Commissioning was conducting IV-curve testing in Block 2 on combiner box 8. Commissioning states to have performed voltage test (VOC) on combiner box with a multimeter device, before opening fuses. Employee in full FR gear, upon opening the fifth combiner box fuse saw fire and smoke. The fire was contained inside the combiner box, melting 5 of the fuses. The small fire was caused by a reverse polarity connection in the string cable. The employee was able to quickly extinguish the Electrical fire by using a fire extinguisher suffered no injuries. The Actual severity rating was selected as A1 since the damage to the combiner box was under 10K and employee within proximity was wearing proper FR PPE. The potential severity rating is B2 since incident could have resulted in medical treatment for burns and blast wounds. Also, the combiner box damage could not have resulted in more than 10-100k in damages.
ImmediateAction: The incident was immediately reported to the superintendent. Incident investigation protocols were put in place by Operations and HSSE site team. The scene was frozen and the electrical fire was extinguished and monitored, de-energized and lock-out into further investigation, photos of the incident were collected. Investigation is ongoing.....

ShortDescription: Wood allowed a 40ft articulated lorry to enter the substation gateway without prior authorisation or agreement with the Client SAP
FullDescription: Wood OHL team arrived at the substation (Wigton 132kV substation) to undertake remediation works from i year ago. The team were awaiting the delivery of equipment to complete the work. The Delivery did not arrive until approx 14:30 and it was only then that the team and General Foreman realised it was delivered on a 40ft curtain sided lorry (far oversized for a small amount of equipment). the local road network outside of the substation gates (in a densely populated housing estate). very quickly the traffic started to build up, and the Wood general foreman decided to guide the wagon forward through the open substation gateway (enough to release the traffic outside the gates). At this point the Western Power distribution (WPD) SAP challenged the GF because the wagon movement through the gateway was not authorised or agreed as per the WPD distribution safety rules. The GF is authorised with WPD and therefore is issued with the rule book and should clearly have known the standard process. Once the traffic dispersed, the wagon was banked backwards (out of the substation gateway, and was manually offloaded. the wagon was then banked backwards in to a position where it could leave the location. No one was hurt or harmed as part of this safety process event - and neither could they have been. The Wood works were allowed to proceed.
ImmediateAction: WPD challenged the Wood General Foreman immediately. The wagon was taken away from the access gateway. Wood Safety Advisor attended the site the following morning to gather facts / photographs / statements. A HEART safety observation was created by the site construction manager. Wood safety advisor has in put the event into CAIRS. Investigation/report has been started.

ShortDescription: A 323 Operator was relocating large rocks, while a smaller of the rocks bounced from the bucket striking the right front cover.
FullDescription: On September 20, 2022 at 1615 a CAT 323 excavator was being used to move rocks from around the edges of the site to a hole where the rocks were to be buried.  The excavator had 3 rocks in the bucket and was curling it to move when a smaller rock fell from the bucket, bounced off the top of the right track, and struck the DEF tank cover. This resulted in a large dent and a split weld on the edge.  The rock was approximately one foot in diameter.The excavator operator stopped and contacted Safety to report the incident.
ImmediateAction: The 323 excavator was brought to the ready line after occurring damage and the investigation was started..

ShortDescription: Excavator bucket impacted existing underground low voltage instrument cable
FullDescription: At approximately 11:00am on Tuesday 20th September the civil contractor was tasked with excavation works for ICR foundation. The conditions were clear and sunny with no visual issues identified. During the excavation the excavator bucket impacted an existing live low voltage fire and gas instrument cable. The impact was minimal due to the protection of the corrugated PVC sleeve that was housing the cable. No red concrete was visible during the excavation. The standby electrical excavation guard was present during the incident and informed the civil team to stop work and also make the area safe. No issues occurred in relation to the refinery operations due to the refinery currently undergoing turnaround activities.
ImmediateAction: Excavation stopped immediately. Area made safe with electrical excavation guard present. Informed Wood electrical and civil superintendents. Client operations also informed.

ShortDescription: Air hose ruptured during surface roughening works
FullDescription: Air hose ruptured during surface roughening works on the 3rd fender foundation with scaling hammer driven by compressed air. Whip arrestors and R-pins were in placed correctly and hose was arrested to prevent any injuries or damage. No one was injured
ImmediateAction: - Stopped work- Initiated investigation process

ShortDescription: x2 Piles impacted existing underground drainage pipe.
FullDescription: At approximately 08:30 on Tuesday 20th September the civil contractor was tasked with excavating in the HRPSA area, north of the exiting pipe rack. During these works it was observed that x2 piles, of which were drilled in May, had impacted the existing underground live drainage pipe, subsequently severely damaging the pipe in x2 areas. No chemical spillage identified initially, only surface water observed.
ImmediateAction: Excavation immediately stopped. Area made safe. Client operations and environmental department informed.

ShortDescription: Wood instrument tech was sprayed with lube oil under pressure while attempting to disconnect a pressure switch for testing.
FullDescription: On 9/19/21 around 3:30PM a Wood instrument tech was working with FSR for 3rd party performing testing on lube oil pressure switches on GTG#2. The crew had successfully tested two pressure switches in the system and had moved to the next one. Wood instrument tech began to loosen the tubing fitting to the pressure switch. When employee lifted the switch off of the tubing lube oil under pressure (aprox 8psi) began spraying out on head and face. Employee was able to put the switch back in place and stopped the oil release. Employee was then able to proceed down to the PTW office bathroom to clean up. Employee was then taken to KOS medical where cleaned up and received minor eye flushing. Employee was released without any issues. At this time supervision and HSE reps went to the location at the GTG to evaluate and take pictures. All permits for any GTG work was suspended. An investigation by Wood HSE began.
ImmediateAction: Suspended all work and permits on GTGs until safe path forward discussed and implemented.

ShortDescription: Scaffold base plate and screw jack congealed in formation of concrete.
FullDescription: At approximately 10:30 on Monday 19th September the civil contractor was tasked with pouring concrete into the assembled formwork in the Clients substation 30 area. The conditions were clear and sunny with no visual issues identified. On completion of the pour it was identified that a screw within the formwork panel had failed and subsequently began to leak a small amount of the cement into the surrounding area. This resulted in the scaffolding base plate and screw jack being congealed within the formation of the concrete.
ImmediateAction: Formwork integrity assured. Area barriered off. Scaffolding base plate and screw jack to be removed.

ShortDescription: IP stepped into a hole causing them to fall and scrap their shin/lower leg.
FullDescription: IP reports while using a hand level, readjusted  feet and stepped in a hole causing to fall backwards, scraping  shin on the rocks.
ImmediateAction: IP contacted PM, HSSE Manager and WorkCare. Self Care was provided by the IP

ShortDescription: Person tested positive to Covid 19 in camp
FullDescription: Person tested positive to Covid 19 in camp.  Required to isolate for at least five days.
ImmediateAction: Required to isolate for at least five days.

ShortDescription: Two employees were involved in a physical altercation
FullDescription: On Monday, 9/19/2022 a boilermaker crew was performing outage work in the unit 3 mills. Employee A and Employee B had apparently been engaged in antagonistic behavior towards each other throughout the day.  At approximately 4:30 PM, EEA was working atop a platform and asked EEB to toss him a water bottle.  EEB loosened the cap on a bottle of water before tossing it up to EEA, causing water to spray out on EEA when he caught it.  In response, EEA descended the ladder and struck EEB on the face with his hand.   The employees' supervisor intervened, deescalated the situation.  EEB sustained a contusion to the lip and EEA sustained a small laceration on their knuckle. An actual severity of C1 was selected as 2 employees sustained injuries requiring first aid.  A potential severity of C2 was determined due to the potential for the strike/altercation to cause an injury requiring medical treatment above and beyond first aid.
ImmediateAction: Involved employees were separated and escorted off site, both terminated effective immediately.
WorkActivities: No work activity being carried out at the time of the incident

ShortDescription: One (1) Massy Wood employee tested positive for COVID-19.
FullDescription: One (1) Massy Wood employee tested positive for COVID-19.
ImmediateAction: Employee taken to designated quarantine area to await demobilization.

ShortDescription: Solar A turbine enclosure exhaust fan blades detached from the Blade Hub
FullDescription: Cooling fans for Solar A failed. Wood Involved Person (IP) was taking an oil sample with a Client Operator (mid point of unit) on Solar A. They both heard a loud noise, the operator went to check what the noise was from. The operator discovered that the mesh covering for the cooling fans cowling on Solar A had been flung out (north most point of unit).  No one was hurt, however, the fan had catastrophically failed.
ImmediateAction: The operator contacted the recommissioning crew, and instructed to turn the machine off.

ShortDescription: Employee tested COVID-19 Positive
FullDescription: An employee tested positive for the COVD-19 Virus.
ImmediateAction: The employee was immediately isolated.

ShortDescription: Gas monitor alarmed indicating elevated Carbon Monoxide (CO) levels
FullDescription: On Sunday September 18th at approx. 15:00 2 VDN Field analysts were packing up their equipment for the day when analyst 1 gas monitor went off indicating elevated levels of Carbon Monoxide. The second analyst alarm also went off shortly afterwards indicating elevated levels of Carbon Monoxide. Analyst 1 attempted to radio in the leak to Shell (client) and on doing so realized his radio was malfunctioning and was unable to hear a response on the emergency channel or the regular channel.  From there, both analysts evacuated the area and headed towards the BRM (Blast Radius Module).
ImmediateAction: Analysts met at the BRM and reported the leak to the sites Operations Team.

ShortDescription: Swelling/internal bleeding in the gluteal muscles related to an assistance job
FullDescription: In connection with scanning/taking pictures of flanges in area M14, the IP was asked to assist the surveyor by holding reflectors. IP sat on a cable tray right next to an oil pump for approx. 30 minutes but moved a bit in between. IP did not notice any discomfort on the same day (Sunday), but on the second day (Monday) there was swelling. On the third day (Tuesday), the IP chose to see the nurse for a check-up when the swelling increased, and he began to feel pain. In addition to the swelling, the nurse noted a fever and results on a CRP test. IP was therefore sent ashore by helicopter for a closer check. Discharged from hospital the same evening but called sick for the rest of his offshore trip.
ImmediateAction: •	IP saw a nurse on day three, and was sent ashore for a closer check in hospital.•	The incident has been reviewed with IP to uncover causes, measures and learning.•	The incident has been reviewed with mobilized personnel and informed to operations/platform management.•	NAV form established •	Safety message established for information and learning.
OtherCauseofInjuryIncident: Sitting in the same position on a hard/sharp surface over time in a confined area

ShortDescription: Whilst a Rope Access team was using a G clamp to hold 2 pieces of steel together the clamp failed and snapped
FullDescription: On Sunday 18th September at approximately 09:45hrs, a subcontractor (KAEFER) Rope Access technician was working at the PDR Lv3 Mezzanine using a G Clamp to clamp 2 pieced of steel together, which was to be drilled. Whilst tightening the clamp the technician was holding the adjustable handle crewing the adjustment screw/clamp. The clamp failed on the body and snapped. Resulting in the top section breaking away from the point of contact and the technician holding the bottom section. The failed piece of the clamp did not come into contact with anybody and fell a short distance to the floor. There was no dropped object risk or impact with personnel.  There were no injuries sustained as there was no contact made. The technician reported the incident and all G Clamps of that make/model and supplier were removed pending a QA/QC investigation with the supplier.
ImmediateAction: All G Clamps of that make/model and supplier were removed pending a QA/QC investigation with the supplier.

ShortDescription: One Wood employee was tested positive for COVID while was offshore.
FullDescription: One Wood employee was tested positive for COVID while was offshore.
ImmediateAction: Disembark + Isolation

ShortDescription: CP-2022-0082 PD Scott Steel; LV struck by rock truck
FullDescription: While attempting to cross the intersection of AR1, a Pick-up truck (LV) was struck on the front passenger side by an articulating rock truck at a speed below 10kmph.
ImmediateAction: During the night an Aecon convoy of four articulating rock trucks were hauling sand loads from Trelawney stockpile to another stockpile located behind the Coarse Ore Pad. The convoy of trucks were traveling in two packs of two. The first two trucks made the turn heading south off of AR1 towards the stockpile and passed a pick-up truck (LV) heading in the opposite direction (north).The LV continued north. When attempting to cross the intersection, the LV was struck on the front passenger side by the leading truck in the second pack of articulating rock trucks.

ShortDescription: Electrical low voltage Arc caused by reverse polarity on the string cable connection
FullDescription: On Saturday, September 17, 2022, around 10:50am, Commissioning employees were conducting IV-curve testing on combiner box 10 PCS 4-6. When the employee opened the third combiner box fuse, an electrical low voltage Arc occurred starting a small fire contained inside the combiner box. The fire melted 3 of the fuses that were inside the box. The arc was caused by a reverse polarity connection in the string cable. The employee was able to quickly contain the Electrical fire by using a 2.5lb. extinguisher, with no injuries. The Actual rating is an A1 since employee within proximity was wearing appropriate FR PPE and no resulting injuries. The potential severity rating is an B2 since incident could had resulted in medical treatment, the damaged could not have resulted in more than 10-100k in damages, and the electrical low voltage fire was contained inside the combiner box.
ImmediateAction: The incident was immediately reported to the superintendent. Incident investigation protocols were put in place by Operations and HSSE site team. The scene was frozen and the electrical low voltage arc was contained and monitored, de-energized and lock-out into further investigation, photos of the incident were collected.

ShortDescription: SIR-Esky removed from site
FullDescription: Crew noticed than an esky had been removed without authority from the laydown area at KP81/82.  Security notified.
ImmediateAction: Reported to security, Police and CA notified
WorkActivities: No work activity being carried out at the time of the incident

ShortDescription: SIR - personal bag stolen
FullDescription: Crew were taking their lunch break and one of the crew left their personal bag near the surveyor's tripod 20m away from the lunch area.  Upon return from lunch it was noticed that the bag was missing.  The crew did not see anyone in the location and the only way someone could have accessed it unseen is by climbing up the slope through the foliage.  Contents of the bag were a dumpy hammer, a personal wallet and a project ID card
ImmediateAction: Reported to security, search done of the area but bag/culprit not found.  Project ID card was cancelled to prevent unlawful access to the Moro Camp.
WorkActivities: No work activity being carried out at the time of the incident

ShortDescription: IP grazed knuckle removing bracket from underneath bench
FullDescription: IP was in the engine room workshop removing a bracket from underneath the bench. A screw wouldn't come off due to being rounded, so IP has wedged a screwdriver in to try and loosen the screw. Whilst applying pressure to the screw driver the screw has come loose unexpectedly. This has resulted in the IP hitting his hand against a tray underneath the desk, causing an injury. The injury is a superficial laceration to the first knuckle of the ring finger. The wound has been cleaned and dressed. Topside Doctor consulted with no concerns expressed.
ImmediateAction: IP consulted the medic. Wound cleaned and no further action / follow up required. Coaching conversation conducted with the IP around dynamic risk assessment and spatial awareness.

ShortDescription: A Wood employee tested positive for Covid-19
FullDescription: A Wood office employee was having symptoms at home and tested positive for Covid-19
ImmediateAction: Employee self-isolated at home

Project: US East - Oil & Gas - All Other Clients
ShortDescription: Dropped Object 5.1oz retainer cap falls 66 feet from crane to the deck.
FullDescription: Third Party personnel located an actuator retaining cap on the stair landing between the main deck and the production deck of the platform. The cap was brought to Safety Specialist. It was discovered that the retainer cap hardware from the crane. Specifically the retainer cap was part of the hardware of the auxiliary winch eccentric actuator, that holds the winch brake arm in place. The incident was not observed and there was no injury. The bolt and locking washer was also located in close proximity to the retainer that was located on the stair landing. Actual: A-1 No Injury; B-1, Potential for minor injury if impact to crew member.
ImmediateAction: All crane operation was suspended. Notifications were made. Additional hardware was located on landing just below the location of where the retainer cap was found. Using the platform drawings it was found that the fall distance of the hardware was 66 feet from the crane to the deck. Near Miss/Dropped Object investigation was initiated and the dropped object calculations resulted in the actual and potential for injury as being minor. Potential (Slight)= First aid case limited or no injury. Treatment may be limited to First Aid. HSE Manager Wood confirmed accuracy of Hess Dropped Object Calculations.

ShortDescription: Wood's employee sprained her ankle while walking outside the office.
FullDescription: During the lunch break of Friday 16th September, Wood's employee went out of the office for personal commissions. While walking on Via Lorenteggio she twisted her ankle.
ImmediateAction: After the event, the employee returned home. In the afternoon she went to the emergency room for further investigations.

ShortDescription: IP struck in face by small locking nut
FullDescription: At approximately 0945hrs on Friday 16th September 2022, a hydratight bolting technician was removing tensioners on the PDR Level 3 Mezz and had started to remove the tensioners from the flange, the team removed several tensioners with no issues. There was one technician working on the above top flange tensioners and another on the bottom flange tensioners. The technician who was working at the top flange had a nut slip out of his hand and struck the noise of the person working directly under, resulting in the person receiving a slight graze to his nose. The nut dropped fell around 7”or 8” inches when it struck the technician. IP reported to the onshore medic for treatment, where his graze was cleaned, no further medical treatment was required and he returned to work.
ImmediateAction: IP reported to the medic for treatment

ShortDescription: IP sustained arm injury while manhandling drums
FullDescription: During the process of removing spent Puraspec adsorbent from Gas Treatment vessel V-2704 A, there was a requirement to transport 4 x 205ltr drums c/w pallet to and from a laydown area. This involved repeatedly filling 4 x 205lts drums, fitting them with lids, transporting them to and from a laydown area, then moving them from the laydown area by forklift, to a flat bed vehicle to be transported offsite to Murphy's yard and unloaded. The process of adsorbent removal involves filling all 4 drums using a double drum filler hopper (2 first, move the filler, then the two remaining drums) then fitting lids to each of the drums, then the forklift would be called forward to move the pallet to the laydown area location onsite,  for the drums to be labelled and secured for onward travel. The work scope, was controlled under permit 16219 - Discharge spent Puraspec adsorbent from V-2704 A, and the forklift / vehicle movements was controlled under permit 15168, adsorbent changeout vehicle movements. All personnel involved in the work scope had a tool box talk (TBT), reviewed the Risk Assessments and signed the work party declaration, as having understood the hazards of the work scope and the controls required to be followed. During one of these pallet & drum movements, one of the Johnson Matthey sub-contractors (Technivac) personnel has requested the forklift driver to move into the forward position to pick up a pallet and 4 drums. The forklift driver has proceeded forward and lifted the pallet c/w drums, and lifted the forks approximately 30/40mm, at this point one of the Technivac employee's has alerted the forklift driver to stop and made a movement forward towards the forklift and load, to apparently secure a loose lid on one of the drums. At this point the forklift driver has immediately stopped the forklift, due to the individual encroaching in the way of the forklift and load. Once the lid had been readjusted / secured, the forklift driver completed the task and removed the pallet c/w drums to the laydown area while the remainder of the work party continued to manually handle drums and unload adsorbent, as per work scope task. Approximately 30mins later, the individual who approached the forklift to allegedly secure a loose lid, reported to the Technivac supervisor and complained of a sore wrist. At this point the individual was advised by the Technivac supervisor to report the incident further, which the individual allegedly declined to do.  Due to conflicting accounts, information and recollections of the incident by Technivac personnel and to provide some clarity as to whether an incident has actually occurred, Wood CATS has instructed Technivac to conduct a full investigation into the circumstances or the situation and report the findings of the investigation back to Wood CATS. Once the findings of this investigation have been concluded, then the CAIRS case and classification will be revisited.
ImmediateAction: Once alleged incident had been reported to CATS OTL, the OTL conducted a stand down for safety tbt with the work party prior to recommencing the work scope. Technivac engaged and asked to conduct full investigation into the alleged incident.
Works suspended incident area secured. Investigation commenced.

ShortDescription: Flushing agent trapped behind blocked manifold splashed onto face
FullDescription: A Night Shift Blaster/Painter team member was cleaning out the Humichar Mix Manifold using Benzyl Alcohol as a flushing agent. They were cleaning out hardened Humichar from a bung cavity using a pick/cleaning tool. When breaking through the hardened product, trapped flushing fluid was released onto their face at low pressure. Safety Glasses donned at the time as per SDS. IP engaged colleague to source nearby eye solution for immediate flushing.
ImmediateAction: Eye washed on location followed by consult and eye flush treatment (saline) with the Medic.IP returned to full normal duties 01:30hrs

ShortDescription: Vehicle witnessed driving in wrong direction.
FullDescription: Vehicle witnessed driving in wrong direction near warehouse parking area. No Damage/accident or Injury
ImmediateAction: Investigation commenced.

FullDescription: One (1) Massy Wood employee tested positive for COVID-19.

ShortDescription: A Wood quality control employee was driving a UTV in reverse to exit fab area and came in contact with another vehicle parked in the area.
FullDescription: At approximately 3 pm, A Wood Quality Control employee was driving a Utility Vehicle (#66-110004) in reverse to exit fab shop area. While backing,  the utility vehicle contacted the tailgate of an unoccupied parked vehicle # 66-110886, causing minor damage to the vehicle tailgate. Potential - Minor damage to parked vehicle unlikely damage would have been greater than $10K.
