ShortDescription: IP sustained small cut to finger
FullDescription: On the 15th September at approx. 16:30 pm on the Clair platform the IP (Kaefer Rope Access Tech) was in the process of walking from the helicopter to the helideck stairway . While holding onto the handrail coming down the stairwell, the IP felt his right hand fore finger catch on something on the underside of handrail, When he came off the stairwell he checked his  finger on his right hand and noticed a small cut to finger. The IP immediately reported the incident to the OIM on arrival into heli-admin, the medic was informed and treated the IP by cleaning the wound and putting a plaster on the cut finger. IP was fit to return to normal work duties.
ImmediateAction: IP reported this to the OIM on arriving in heli admin and then medic was called where he received treatment for the injury.The Medic cleaned the injury and applied plaster to the cut
WorkActivities: No work activity being carried out at the time of the incident
OtherCauseofInjuryIncident: Holding onto the underside of handrail

ShortDescription: Wood parked vehicle on site was bumped into causing damage to the break light
IncidentAssignedTo: Other Person (Will not count on Statistical Reporting)
FullDescription: QC Inspector had parked near T4228 to complete an inspection with the client. The van was parked on a road, which is not a through road, as one end was blocked off with a barrier. There was three other vehicles parked on the same road, one was another Wood vehicle driven by a Wood site supervisor and was parked behind the damaged vehicle, one was the standby mans vehicle which was not parked anywhere near the damaged vehicle and the last vehicle was another business partner of ESSAR.  The QC Inspector entered the tank and on return approx. 20 minutes later he found the damage on the vehicle.
ImmediateAction: Reported to the HHSE Advisor and vehicle returned to workshop to be inspected. Statement taken from QC Inspector.

ShortDescription: Confirmed COVID 19 cases at NAZA Towers
FullDescription: 3 Personnel tesetd positive for Covid19
ImmediateAction: The IPs were sent home to self isolate. No close contacts identified and disinfection was done to their work place,

ShortDescription: The lifting crews noticed the pin retainer clip of the crane boom was missing while lifting the metal plate.
FullDescription: One of the lifting crews noticed the pin retainer clip of the crane boom was missing while they were lifting the metal plate (2.22 tons) from the trailer plate. The pin was remaining in its designed position but there was no pin retainer clip installed as it should be. The metal plate lifting operation is done using the auxiliary hook. The main hook/block, where the missing pin retainer clip is located, is not used at the time of operation. The lifting team stopped the lifting activities and notified their work supervisor and HSSE personnel. No injury and no asset damage from this near miss.
ImmediateAction: Immediate Action Taken: 1.	Safety stand-down for entire workers of lifting operation that included topic below.•	The lifting operation team has been reemphasized to check and rectify any missing part of the crane before working. •	The lifting team shall make sure the load is trialed lift and balancing the load before real lifting.•	At least 2 taglines shall be tied with the sling/load to control the load direction while being lifted. •	Everyone shall not stand in the moving path of load. •	Every time after finishing the lifting operation. The crane boom shall be moved away from the road/traffic route. •	The signalman shall stand in the right position where the crane operator can see the signalman. •	The workers shall conduct pre-task talks to understand the work detail, and work steps and define the responsible person before commencing work.  2.	Report the near misses to project management and corporate HSSE&S Manager3.	Investigation commenced.

ShortDescription: The metal plate dropped to ground level while it was unloading from the trailer truck. No injury, No asset damaged.
FullDescription: To lift a metal plate from the trailer bed for placement on the ground, two vertical lifting clamps were attached to it. Using the crane’s auxiliary hook, the metal plate was lifted up where concurrently it started to rotate causing one of the lifting clamps to dislodged. The metal plate was therefore held on by the remaining clamp. The lifting zone was barricaded. Nobody was in the line of fire, nobody was injured and there was no property damage.
ImmediateAction: 1.	Safety stand-down for entire workers of lifting operation that included topic below.•	The lifting operation team has been reemphasized to check and rectify any missing part of the crane before working. •	The lifting team shall make sure the load is trialed lift and balancing the load before real lifting.•	At least 2 taglines shall be tied with the sling/load to control the load direction while being lifted. •	Everyone shall not stand in the moving path of load. •	Every time after finishing the lifting operation. The crane boom shall be moved away from the road/traffic route. •	The signalman shall stand in the right position where the crane operator can see the signalman. •	The workers shall conduct pre-task talks to understand the work detail, and work steps and define the responsible person before commencing work.  2.	Report the near misses to project management and corporate HSSE&S Manager3.	Investigation commenced.

Project: US East - Oil & Gas - All Other Clients
ShortDescription: IP lost footing while performing a training task and fell striking his abdomen on the door frame of the lifeboat.
FullDescription: IP was attending lifeboat proficiency training at training facility. At approximately 1000hrs IP was conducting proficiency task in the lifeboat. IP  was retrieving the life rings from the water using an extension pole when IP lost his footing and fell landing against the lifeboat door frame. IP received injury to his lower abdomen below the naval as a result of the fall. IP reported minor soreness in the affected area. IP was seen by the Instructor/Emergency Medical Tech and it was determined that IP could resume training training without restriction. Actual: A1 Minor discomfort to abdomen area, but no first aid needed. Potential:  B2-Possible medical treatment had the fall produced a more serious injury.
ImmediateAction: Incident was reported as per protocols and IP's injury is being monitored and further evaluation will be provided if injury worsens. Investigation is in progress and will be conducted on the training facility by Account Manager and HSE Manager.

ShortDescription: 24" Pipe Line Broken for Disinvestment, Spacer removed from Flange and Lifted to Ground Level - Identified as Potential of CAF
FullDescription: Ledwood's Mechanical & Rigging Team were undertaking disinvestment Pipework & Vessels on the GTU Structure (C1724), A 24" Pipe to Vessel Flange was Broken and a Spacer was lifted out to ground level. During a worksite Inspection a Sabic Construction Superintendent raised concerns that the Gasket on the removed Spacer may be CAF. Barriers and Signage were placed around the suspected material and the Asbestos Contractor Notified. 16:30 on the 14.09.22.Scaffolding Contractor dismantled second lift of Scaffolding, concerns raised regarding the potential for ACM Material contaminating the Scaffolding Structure 15:30 on the 15.09.22.All Stop Called, Investigation commenced, Samples of suspected gasket taken and sent for analysis, Operative de-robed and clothing bagged for disposal. Potential Operatives have not followed protocol when breaking joints, with a potential for Asbestos. Asbestos Register Checked no initial identification of ACM on 24" Line.
ImmediateAction: Suspected CAF Gasket Segregated Via Barriers, Worksite Access Restricted and Barriers Placed around Worksite, Commenced with Investigations, Notification to  Site Management Arrangements for Licensed Asbestos Contractor to perform Sampling & Cleaning,Addressed Scaffolding Team to Provide Assurance of SMS, Sampling & Investigation, Mechanical, Rigging & Scaffolding Team De-Robed & Clothing Disposed of.

ShortDescription: SIR - Esky stolen and container lock broken
FullDescription: Crew noticed an esky had been removed from site and that a lock was broken on a storage container.  Initial inspection of container identified nothing taken from inside.
ImmediateAction: Lock to be replaced. CA notified
WorkActivities: No work activity being carried out at the time of the incident

ShortDescription: Snapped Bilok fitting
FullDescription: What happened: While conducting pre-tubing for Bilok change out the worker was installing a new bracket in parallel with existing tubing. The works in the area disturbed the existing tubing resulting in a Bilok fitting below snapping off above the isolation valve.
ImmediateAction: Action: Platform Operations and OIM notified, broken small bore tubing replaced. No release of hydrocarbons as the Process was down due to compressor being shut down for maintenance issue.

ShortDescription: Deer struck the front of the Wood vehicle as EE was on his way to work.
FullDescription: On September 13, 2022 at 6:35 am, a Wood EE was traveling to work near Lamesa, TX when a deer walked onto the road and was struck by the front of his Wood vehicle. Impact caused damage to the front of the Wood vehicle; including the grill guard, hood, fender and passenger side headlight. Actual (A1) repairs not expected to exceed 10k; Potential (A1): Deer strikes typically do not cause severe damage to our vehicles.
ImmediateAction: Wood EE reported the incident to his manager.

ShortDescription: Animal struck the front of a Wood vehicle as EE was traveling home from location.
FullDescription: On September 13, 2022 at 3:43 am, a Wood EE was traveling home from location near Gail, TX when an animal ran out and struck the front of his Wood vehicle. Due to the time of day, it was difficult for the EE to determine what type of animal struck the vehicle. Impact caused damage to the left headlamp and fender on the Wood vehicle. Actual (A1): Repairs not expected to exceed 10k; Potential (A1): Animal strikes typically do not cause severe damage to our vehicles.
ImmediateAction: Wood EE notified Account manager.

ShortDescription: A panel dropped down from ceiling
FullDescription: At 2 p.m. on 13 September, at first floor of Milan Office, where is located ENTER Almalyk Task Force, a panel fell from the ceiling to the ground. Nobody was injured or was in close proximity of the landing point.
ImmediateAction: Inspection of the incident area.Called to facility management and maintenance to repair the panel and verify status of others.Inspection with Ceiling contractor scheduled next saturday 17th September.

ShortDescription: NWR - Person tested positive to Covid 19 in camp
FullDescription: Person tested positive to Covid 19 in camp.  Required to isolate for five days.

ShortDescription: Hammer head came off during use.
FullDescription: While reinstalling retainer pins on impact crusher, employee's hammer head came off resulting in a near miss.  Hammer head came in contact with right knee.  The failure occurred because of pre-existing crack in hammer handle that should have been reported during pre-op inspection and hammer taken out of service. Employee did not do a pre-op inspection on hand tool.
ImmediateAction: Hammer was taken out of service.  Safety stand-down with all employees to discuss incident.  Training conducted with entire crew regarding pre-op inspections.  Safety stand-down with all employees to discuss All current hand tools will be inspected, deficiencies noted, unserviceable tools will be repaired and/or replaced.

ShortDescription: 815 roller left entry ladder lower step damage
FullDescription: During normal operations an 815-roller compactor operator was compacting a lift.  While conducting his task a rock was kicked up after he rolled over it causing it to dislodge and rotate bending the left entry ladder lower step.
ImmediateAction: Incident reviewed with operator, training conducted with entire crew during morning meeting.

ShortDescription: Wood contractor vehicle was struck from the back by a third party vehicle during commute, no injuries to personnel.
FullDescription: On Sunday 13 Sep 2022, a Wood Subcontractor (Al Majal) driver was traveling with a Wood Engineer onboard. They were traveling from Basrah to WQ1 heading towards the engineer's work place. The driver conducted the vehicle at a speed limit of 50-60 km/hr. As he was approaching around off under the ALASKARI bridge Heading from Baghdad Street to the WQ1 road, the driver slowed the vehicle to 40km/hr which was the time when the vehicle was struck from the back by another third-party (GMC). The driver took the vehicle under control immediately and parked at the side of the road., it was established that the incident was caused by the civilian GMC Vehicle
ImmediateAction: 1- Al Majal fleet lead has sent another vehicle to take Wood engineers to their destination.2- Another vehicle took Wood engineers to the Hospital for a Medical check.

ShortDescription: Spall fell on worker shoulder
FullDescription: Welder was welding when he felt something dropped on his right shoulder. He stopped work and saw that it was broken piece of spall. He reported to his supervisor. Project activated incident management protocol.  Spall weight - 200g, fell from 8M.
ImmediateAction: Work stopped,IP immediately informed his supervisor and HSSE personal.IP was brought to project medical centre for review by doctor.

ShortDescription: IP (EG national) reported to the medic with chest pain
FullDescription: * IP complained of chest pain and reported to offshore medic around 10.30.  It was recommended by the offshore Medic (after evaluation he was treated and an ECG conducted) that the IP be sent onshore to La Paz Hospital for further evaluation. IP has a history of high blood pressure.
ImmediateAction: * IP was transferred from offshore (FPSO) by crew boat and arrived onshore around 1415. The IP was then transported by ambulance to La Paz Hospital accompanied by the PM and Client Medic.* La Paz conducted an ECG which was found to be normal.  Oxygen levels were also normal.* IP admitted to an observation room for what is expected to be 48 hours.  The IP has a history of high BP, La Paz hospital will administer medicine to bring it to normal. The IP also has high Cholesterol.* The PM has provided the hospital with emergency contact details and will monitor the IP's condition.  Plan to return to the hospital tomorrow for follow up.* The IP stated that they are feeling better than they were earlier in the day.  The IP's family was contacted by the IP to inform them of the situation.* 14 Sep 2022 - IP was discharged from hospital.  Treated for: Peptic disease (IP has a history of experiencing these symptoms in previous years after experiencing trauma in 2016) and also for: Hypertension.  IP was evaluated by a cardiologist and all was found to be normal.* The Client has requested that an evaluation be done on the IP's stress levels prior to returning offshore.

ShortDescription: Wood Instrument Tech was descending the scaffold stairs from the platform and twisted his left ankle.
FullDescription: Around 10:15AM a Wood Instrument Tech was descending the north side scaffold stairs, using 4 points of contact, from the platform to ground level. As employee was approximately at the fourth stair tread his left foot stepped on the front edge of the tread causing the left ankle to roll outward resulting in immediate discomfort. The employee was able to maintain position using the handrails and continued to ground level where he called a co-worker for assistance. The supervisor was called and then notified Wood HSE. Injured employee was directed to the on site infirmary for evaluation. On site medics treated for sprain with ice and OTC meds. Wood HSE transported employee to local occupational clinic for further evaluation where he was treated and released back to work with left ankle sprain. Actual B1 due to one injury and potential B2 based on stair case distance/span and nature of injury.
ImmediateAction: Employee was taken to the onsite infirmary for initial treatment. Employee was then transported to local occupational medical clinic for further evaluation. All appropriate notifications were made.

ShortDescription: IP sustained minor scratch injury to his right nostril.
FullDescription: At 11.30am on the 12th September 2022 the IP (Kaefer Rope Access Tech) working on the Clair platform had been working overside on the C7 Caisson work scope using rope access equipment. While heading back inboard climbing over the handrail barrier the IP stepped off the final hard barrier when his ASAP Lock Back-up device swung upwards and made contact with the right hand side of his nose. The IP noticed some blood coming from the scratch on his nose and reported immediately to the medic on the platform. The IP was treated by the medic by cleaning the wound and applying steri-strips(2) to the nose wound. The IP after treatment returned to normal work duties.
ImmediateAction: IP stopped work and then proceeded to the medic where he received treatment for the injury.The platform medic cleaned the injury and applied 2 steri-strips to the scratch on the IP,s nose, then the IP returned to work.

ShortDescription: (2) Wood EE's  were engaged in a physical altercation.
FullDescription: On Monday 9/12/2022 @ ~17:00pm,  (2) Wood employees were involved a verbal altercation which escalated to a physical altercation. The (2) Wood EE's were involved in a discussion of non-work related topics when the discussion progressed to a verbal altercation. Wood EE1 gathered their personal belongings and attempted to leave the work area, when Wood EE2 blocked their exit from the work area and attempted to put their hands on Wood EE1. Wood EE1 requested Wood EE2 to move from their path of travel and move away from their personal space, at which time Wood EE2 struck Wood EE1 scratching his neck, top of nose and right eye. Wood EE1 was able to flee the area and notified Wood Supervision, Wood HSSES, Dow Supervision, and Dow ESS of the incident. Potential - potential outcome of incident could have resulted RMTC for one or both involved employees.
ImmediateAction: Wood Supervision, Wood HSSES, Dow Supervision, Dow EHS, Dow ESS notified of altercation. Dow ESS responded and evaluated both employees, who were then released to Wood HSSES. Both employees taken to off-site OccMed for evaluation and post-incident drug screening. Both Wood employees Dow badges were seized and access restricted pending outcome of investigation.

ShortDescription: 2# FIre Extinguisher discharged inside cab of Komatsu D65 dozer
FullDescription: The Komatsu D65 dozer arrived at site without a fire extinguisher or a mount to install a fire extinguisher.  A 2 pound fire extinguisher was placed inside the cab on the door.  At 3 pm  September 12, 2022 the extinguisher came out and rolled under the seat, where the seat bounced onto the handle releasing extinguishing agent.  The operator got some of the agent in their eyes.
ImmediateAction: The operator called on the radio to say the fire extinguisher had gone off.  The operator opened the door, got out, and then got back into the dozer to move it out of the way of traffic. They stopped and immediately washed them out with water and saline solution.  The operator claims they did not inhale any extinguishing agent that they can tell - breathing was fine at assessment at 4:15 pm.   Their eyes were irritated and treated with 'Tears" replacement to soothe them.  The operator stated that all was okay and drove home.  Safety contact information was provided and the operator was told to call if anything got worse during the night.

ShortDescription: NWR - person tested positive to Covid 19 in camp
FullDescription: Person in camp tested positive to Covid 19.  Required to isolate for at least five days
ImmediateAction: Person required to isolate for at least five days.

ShortDescription: EI-leak of 10-15ml hydraulic fluid to grade
FullDescription: EI – A hydro-carbon substance (approximately 10-15ml) was identified on the surface of a rain puddle under a parked up Laurini (PP216) in the Moro Workshop Yard.  The Laurini had been parked there for several weeks awaiting repair for a non-hydraulic fault.Initial inspection by the maintenance team indicates the leak may be related to the gearbox, further investigation is to take place to identify the source of leak and the exact fluid.Spill mats were used to absorb the water and hydro-carbon.  The contaminated ground was removed to the correct contaminated waste area.
ImmediateAction: Spill mats were used to absorb the water and hydro-carbon.  The contaminated waste was removed to the correct contaminated waste area.
WorkActivities: No work activity being carried out at the time of the incident

ShortDescription: Work crew assigned to carry out blinding work, they were splashed by remnant product inside the pipe
FullDescription: 4 workers inclusive of the supervisor were tasked to carry out blinding activity on pump 3RG800B suction line. When they were opening the last bolt they were splashed by remnant product inside the pipe. Splashed workers activated emergency shower to wash. Project personnel activated emergency rescue team and Shift Superintendent was notified immediately.
ImmediateAction: Project personnel activated Emergency Rescue Team and Shift Superintendent was notified immediately. 4 workers were brought to CRISP medical centre further examination. Workers has been examined by the CRISP Clinic doctor and has no visible skin irritation or injuries due to exposure. Area was barricaded. No one was injured.Investigation initiated.

ShortDescription: Work crew assigned to carry out blinding work, they were splashed by remnant product inside the pipe
FullDescription: 4 workers inclusive of the supervisor were tasked to carry out blinding activity on pump 3RG800B suction line. When they were opening the last bolt they were splashed by remnant product inside the pipe. Splashed workers activated emergency shower to wash. Project personnel activated emergency rescue team and Shift Superintendent was notified immediately.
ImmediateAction: Splashed workers activated emergency shower to wash. Project personnel activated ERT and Shift Superintendent was notified immediately. 4 workers were brought to CRISP medical centre for further examination. Area was barricaded. No one was injured. Investigation initiated.

ShortDescription: NWR - person tested positive to Covid 19 in camp
FullDescription: Person tested positive to Covid 19 in camp.  Required to isolate for at least five days.
ImmediateAction: Isolate for at least five days

ShortDescription: ASTEC 4250  had material build up inside creating a crack in the corner of outer framework and weld
FullDescription: On September 9, 2022 at approximately 1300 during normal operations of the ASTEC 4250 impact crusher rocks/mud built up under the grizzley bars area under the feeder.  The area where the rocks/mud built up was designed with a space between the flow of material and the outer wall, resulting in material falling beneath the chute. This material compacted due to vibration and pushed against the framework/outer wall.  This created a crack in the outer frame and weld.     The crusher operator was looking for the source of why the crusher wasn't running as usual and opened the  access door to the area.  He saw that the material was built up and then noticed the crack  in the frame.
ImmediateAction: The crusher was shut down to clean out the compacted material and repair the crack

ShortDescription: CP-2022-0081 PD NANJV; damage to haul truck
FullDescription: Haul Truck Operator entered a soft rutted work area and prepared to back into position when the cab began to lift off the ground. Operator attempted to correct themselves by turning the steering wheel in the opposite direction; however, the cab continued to slowly lean and ended up on its left side where it came to rest. Operator was wearing seatbelt at time of incident. No injuries sustained.
ImmediateAction: Work stopped, scene frozen and supervisor contacted. Canadian Model followed. Incident Investigation initiated.

ShortDescription: A rubber belt attached to a Portland cement silo, caught on fire shortly after the motor was turned off.
FullDescription: A rubber belt that drives a mount driven motor which is attached to a Portland cement silo, caught on fire shortly after the motor was turned off. A Wood crane operator leaving his crane for break could smell smoke. He took the fire extinguisher from the crane and extinguished the small flame at the end of rubber belt.
ImmediateAction: Production was brought to a halt with the hopper until further investigative actions can be taken.

ShortDescription: Delivery Driver hit the card reader with car damaging the faceplate of the card reader.
IncidentAssignedTo: Visitor (Will not count on Statistical Reporting)
FullDescription: Independent delivery driver from Home Depot in their own car dropping offmaterials to AIS. Driver drove into the site and parked in front of AIS office made delivery then as she wasattempting to back out and leave the site she didn't see the card reader and hit it with her car damaging thefaceplate of the card reader.
ImmediateAction: AIS will take full responsibility in the cost of replacing the damaged card reader.

ShortDescription: While tightening pipe in chain vice the pipe slipped causing employee to fall to ground.
FullDescription: Employee was tasked to tighten fitting on coated 3 inch pipe that was secured in chain vice on roustabout bed.  During the action the pipe slipped in the vice causing the employee to fall to the ground.  Employee did not report the incident right away as they thought nothing was hurting.  Later that evening the IE stated that their right leg had some pain in it.  IE notified wood supervision on 12 Sept.  Stated that they wrapped and iced it all weekend and it did not go away.  They did not wish to seek primary doctor to check it out at this time but wanted it noted.  Investigation is on going at this time.B1 as is report only at this time  B2 as could be restricted or medical treatment
ImmediateAction: Investigation
OtherHazardSource: Ergonomics rapid change when pipe spun in vise.

ShortDescription: One Wood employee tested positive for COVID during premobilization screening.
FullDescription: One Wood employee tested positive for COVID during premobilization screening. EE is asymptomatic and returned home for isolation. No contact tracing required.
ImmediateAction: EE instructed to return home for isolation.

ShortDescription: IP received puncture wound to finger
FullDescription: While making up a cable Gland for turbine B vent fan, the IP felt a small prick from the wire braid from the inner sheath of the cabling. At the time the IP was wearing Skytec ohio gloves. The IP removed the gloves at the time, however was unable to find the point of entry as it showed no signs of bleeding. The IP continued on working and later came in for his evening meal and washed his hands as normal. The IP went back out on the plant after 6.45 to progress with vent fan enclosure 3 core 95mm 440V cabling. The IP never thought anything more of it at the time then during the night he woke up with a throb from my finger.  When he got up, he went down to see the medic just after 6am for a consultation. Following the consultation with the medic and Topsides Doctor, the IP was issued with prescription strength antibiotics. However, clarification needs to be confirmed as to whether the prescription antibiotics were precautionary.
ImmediateAction: IP reported to the medic and was subsequently given prescription strength antibiotics. However, clarification needs to be confirmed as to whether the prescription antibiotics were precautionary.

Project: US East - Oil & Gas - All Other Clients
ShortDescription: IP trips on first step of stairs while descending from Helipad.
FullDescription: IP arriving by helicopter for crew change was descending the stairs to the Helipad when he miss stepped on the first tread of stairway and fell in a seated position. IP maintained a continuous hold on the stairway hand rail that minimized potential injury.
ImmediateAction: IP was evaluated by the onsite Medic. Medic reported to Hess OIM and HSE that IP had no signs of injury and that IP was not complaining of any pain associated to the incident.  Hess HSE will investigate as a Near Miss Incident.

ShortDescription: IP struck thumb with hammer while removing nuts from a flange
FullDescription: While conducting a task to spade a F 3101 vessel, the team were removing bolts from a flange to allow the  blind spade to be put in place. Hand tools were to be used to remove the bolts. This will include spanners, wrench and hacksaw. The work area had some sections where the removal of nuts would be restrictedFlogging spanners will be used to to remove bolts that are seized. This task requires the flogging spanner to be struck by a hammer to loosen the bolt.While conducting the flogging task the IP was distracted by a call from a colleague shouting an instruction form the ground level. As this happened he lost his focus  and hit the spanner off center. This caused the hammer to continue past the spanner and contact the top of his right thumb at the joint with his hand.The IP felt a bit of pain and went to see his supervisor. He was seen by  a first aider, the IPs thumb red at the knuckle and slightly swollen. The IP had full movement and rotation. No treatment was required.
ImmediateAction: HSE inspected the worksite and looked at the task.Impact gloves were provided and coaching to keep a focus during the task

ShortDescription: Incorrect Documentation for Task (RAMS), Activity Leading to a Potential Release of Asbestos Containing Material (ACM's)
FullDescription: Civil Contractor executed a scope of work which was not covered by their RAMS and Permit to Work leading to damage to potentially asbestos containing material.
ImmediateAction: Task was stopped and personnel removed from area.Exclusion zone established. Alert issued to SABIC & Wood Management Teams. Licensed Asbestos Contractor was requested to perform, sample, cleaning & disposal operations.Meetings held with Civil Contractors Management Team, with clear expectations of Incident Investigation and Report Collation.

ShortDescription: hot ashpalt binder splashed on heater which caught fire.
FullDescription: IP was conducting a flashpoint test of hot asphalt binder. The test was completed.  Thinking that the valve to the propane flame was not working properly, IP reached out to disconnect the valve to the small propane tank, and jostled the heater which held the pot of asphalt binder.  The asphalt binder splashed onto the heater and caught fire.  The size of the flame was about 5" in diameter and 3" tall. The fire extinguisher that was used was a Carbon Dioxide (CO2) fire extinguisher.  One brief expel of CO2 gas was enough to extinguish the flame.
ImmediateAction: Used fire extinguisher to extinguish the fire

ShortDescription: Unauthorised car drove on to site through main gates behind forklift truck
FullDescription: A new forklift truck (FLT) was being off-loaded by the site FLT driver and being brought on to site via the main security gates. As the FLT driver approached the double gates, the security guard opened both gates to allow entry of FLT. The FLT driver stopped before entering gates noticing an unknown individual in a car behind following the FLT.  The FLT driver signalled to the individual in the car that they cannot access the site and should park in the visitor's carpark. The car driver acknowledged the FLT driver with a thumbs up. However, the driver of the car continued to follow the FLT through the double gates and proceed onto the plant then turning right approaching Train 2. The FLT driver noticed the car had entered site, exited the FLT and followed the car on foot. The car stopped and the FLT driver instructed car driver to leave site.The car left the site and the car driver was questioned by site security to determine why he had entered the site. The car driver stated they were new to the area and they were following sat-nav instructions. The driver was instructed to park the car in the visitors car park, but after briefly parking in the staff car park he left site without further communication.Security informed the police of the incident and the registration details of the car. The police confirmed that the driver was a young apprentice who had been trying to find another nearby site and had lost his way.
ImmediateAction: The car was asked to leave site and return to the visitors car park. The car details were reported to the local police who followed up with the driver.

ShortDescription: SI-Damage to property in storage container
FullDescription: EQR-Moro-SI– Unknown perpetrators have broken into the storage container at the base of the slope at KP64 Phase 1 sometime between the crew leaving site on the afternoon of the 6th September and arriving back on the morning of the 7th September.  Initial reports are some items have been damaged.  Early indications are there were no night shift security personnel present at the location (TBC).Awaiting further information to confirm if any items have been removed from the container.
ImmediateAction: Assessment of damage and review inventory to check for stolen items.
WorkActivities: No work activity being carried out at the time of the incident

ShortDescription: One (1) Massy Wood employee tested positive for COVID-19.
FullDescription: One (1) Massy Wood employee tested positive for COVID-19.
ImmediateAction: Employee taken to designated quarantine area to await demobilization.

ShortDescription: Person in camp tested positive to Covid 19.
FullDescription: Person in camp tested positive to Covid 19. Required to isolate for at leas 5 days
ImmediateAction: Required to isolate for at leas 5 days

ShortDescription: 2-foot rock rolled down slope into adjacent work area
FullDescription: On September 6, 2022 an SBI haul truck was dumping alluvium soil to be used as cover.  There was a 2 foot rock in the load which rolled down the slope when dumped.  The rock rolled down a 1200 foot slope, went over a 6 foot berm, and landed between the NA Degerstrom water stand and landed between the NA Degerstrom water stand and their generator truck.
ImmediateAction: Immediately, the dozer operator called out on the radio that a rock was rolling down the slope, which is the protocol when this occurs. He contacted the water truck operator located at the water stand who was able to get to a safe area before the rock came to rest.  The road at the base of the slope had been closed off and no personnel were in that area.                       Work was stopped to enable a lift to be placed on the berm to raise the height to approximately 10 feet.  The rock was removed from the water stand area.

ShortDescription: One Wood employee was tested positive for COVID while offshore.
FullDescription: One Wood employee was tested positive for COVID while offshore.
ImmediateAction: Disembark + Isolation

ShortDescription: Zero-turn mower operating under solar modules contacted string cable causing separation of the interconnects.
FullDescription: Zero-turn mower operator was task with vegetation maintenance between the arrays in block 6. At approximately 9:45am the operator was mowing under the solar module and came to a stop due to a post. The operator backed up to go around the post and as he backed up, a cable string became lodged in the rollover protection bar folding location resulting in a complete disconnection of the string cable. Where was no exposed electrical wires and no arc from disconnection.The spotter in duty did not see the cable become lodged to the machine at the time of accordance.  No injuries resulted from asset damage.
ImmediateAction: Operation immediately stopped. Wood Project Management, HSSE&S, and Strata Solar Services (Client O&M Contractor) were notified. Investigation initiated. All mower operators were informed not to mow pass the torque tube to avoid close proximity to string cables.

ShortDescription: Minor Graze to employee face
FullDescription: While passing scaffold tube from one level to the next, one end of scaffold tube contacted structure causing it deflect and graze the scaffolders face.
ImmediateAction: Incident reported immediately. Graze cleaned and ice applied. Scaffolder returned to normal duties.

ShortDescription: IP walked into a pipe flange which was resting on a pallet resulting in abrasion of right shin.
FullDescription: While IP was sorting through pipe flanges in laydown, they moved across a pallet striking their shin on a  pipe flange resulting in minor abrasion of right shin.
ImmediateAction: Employee went to clinic where a bandage was applied and returned to work.

ShortDescription: RECIEVED A CALL FROM GUARD JASON.W ON CHRISTCHURCH MAIN YARD @23.59 TO REPORT THAT HE HAD JUST CAUGHT 2 MALES BREAKING INTO SITE. THE 2 MALE
FullDescription: RECIEVED A CALL FROM GUARD JASON.W ON CHRISTCHURCH MAIN YARD @23.59 TO REPORT THATHE HAD JUST CAUGHT 2 MALES BREAKING INTO SITE.THE 2 MALES WERE CHASED OFF SITE BY SECURITY WHILST POLICE WERE CALLED. POLCECHECKED LOCAL AREA AND THEN ATTENDED SITE @02.06 TO TAKE REPORT/PICTURES.1 X PADLOCK OFF ONE OF THE STORAGE CONTAINERS HAD BEEN CUT BUT NOTHING APPEARS TOHAVE BEEN STOLEN, GUARD INTERCEPTED BEFORE THEY COULD GRAB ANYTHING.A CALL WAS MADE TO DANIEL ROLLINSON (WOOD SITE MANAGER) TO INFORM HIM OF THE INCIDENT.POLICE LEFT SITE @02.33 CRIME REFERENCE 4422 0362 872FULL REPORT SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL TO OPERATIONS AND FORWARDED TO LINGWOODS MD ANDMANAGERS
ImmediateAction: Reported to Police
WorkActivities: No work activity being carried out at the time of the incident

FullDescription: Person in camp tested positive to Covid 19. Required to isolate for at least 5 days.

ShortDescription: Wood employee assigned in Shallow water platform tested positive for Covid-19
FullDescription: A Wood employee tested positive for Covid19 during managed quarantine. The IP is currently asymptomatic and was sent home for self isolation and monitoring of our company OH team.

FullDescription: One (1) Massy Wood employee tested positive for COVID-19.

ShortDescription: Symptomatic Covid case NWR
FullDescription: IP reported positive for COVID after experiencing symptoms. IP currently on annual leave not been present at site since 2nd September.
ImmediateAction: IP remains at home.

ShortDescription: Burned control transformer in BUS transfer switch
FullDescription: At aprox 16:30 Electrical & Controls Manager informed Safety Manager on minor amount of smoke in the M39 room, smoke came from unknown location. Straight after notification Safety Manager came to to the place of event where was no visible smoke. Using thermovision camera and sense of smell BUS transfer switch was assessed as a possible source of smoke. Prior opening BUS transfer switch was denergized by LOTO team. After opening doors visible smoked wall of he enclosure was found behind control transformer box. Control transformer box was opened which exposed burned one of the transformer coil. BUS transfer switch was designed assembled and delivered as a whole in a external manufacturer. Equipment was not open for prolonged period of time. No body in the vicinity of the area. Control transformer enclosed in separate box preventing from spreading the fire.
ImmediateAction: Determining source of the smoke by thermovision cameraIsolation and applying LOTO locks on the feeder of the assessed equipment  Opening the box and verification source of the smoke

ShortDescription: IP felt discomfort in the left elbow
FullDescription: IP was tasked with the removal and replacement of PRV's (x12) on COT tanks 1 & 4 Port / Starboard. The work party consisted of a 2 man team comprised of a Mechanical Technician (IP) and the Marine Cargo Operator.The work party visited the worksite at 1.30pm on Saturday 3rd September, they held a Toolbox Talk along with the LOLER Focal Point who was tasked with installing rigging equipment for the valves.The 2 members of the work party commenced with the task. The valves had previously been placed on site the day before. The work party would reduce the bolts on flange to minimum, they would then don Breathing Apparatus for the initial breaking of containment. They proceeded with the task and had removed and reinstated PRV's on COT 4. At approximately 16.30hrs the IP was torqueing bolts using a 24mm spanner. Once he had completed this, he felt some discomfort in his left elbow. IP stated that he did not make contact with his arm against any plant / equipment, nor did he apply any additional / excessive force whilst torqueing the bolts.The IP did not visit the Medic at this time. They continued with the task and at the end of shift 6.30pm. The IP did not feel any discomfort or pain and decided to visit the gymnasium. The next morning he felt fine and again there was no pain or discomfort. At approximately 11am, the IP could feel a dull ache pain on his left elbow and found it difficult to maintain a hold / grip of the spanner. After lunch, he visited the Medic who was unavailable in the sickbay and the IP did not feel it warranted a Tannoy for the medic. The IP made a request to his colleague to finish off the task with the MCO, whilst he proceeded to tidy the Mechanical Workshop. The IP attended a safety meeting in Heli-Admin at 15.30 - 16.30. afterwards he again visited the sickbay where he saw the medic and was administered medication. The IP was de-mobbing the next morning. During the interview process with the offshore HSEA, the IP stated that there was no issue with the access/ egress to the worksite and he maintained good body posture throughout the task. He also stated that the tools in use were suitable for the task and the bolts removed form the existing PRV's were in excellent condition.
ImmediateAction: IP visited the medic and was given over the counter strength medication. The IP stated in his statement that he did not require the medication, however the medic insisted he take it as a precaution. IP de-mobbed the next morning.

ShortDescription: A Wood site employee tested positive for COVID-19.
FullDescription: A Wood site employee tested positive for COVID-19 whilst offsite.
ImmediateAction: Wood site employee self-isolated.

ShortDescription: 9kg fire extinguisher fitted to rear of telehandler was perforated during the removal of materials from a 20" container
FullDescription: Telehandler was in the process of removing drilling products from a 20’ container when contact was made, perforating the extinguisher causing a release of dry powder.Nobody was in the line of fire.
ImmediateAction: Scene preserved.Photos taken.

ShortDescription: Employee tested COVID-19 Positive.
FullDescription: An employee was tested positive for the COVID-19 Virus.
ImmediateAction: The employee was immediately isolated.

ShortDescription: Employee tested COVID-19 Positive
FullDescription: An employeees was tested positive for the COVID-19 Virus.
ImmediateAction: Employee was immediately isolated.

ShortDescription: A Wood employee tripped on a valve handle and sustained minor scrapes and bruising.
FullDescription: On Friday, September 2, 2022, at approximately 1430, The IP was working in a Pod building. The IP tripped over an orbit valve and fell onto a dumb valve assembly. This caused minor scrapes on the IP’s finger, head, and bruising near the groin. The Actual Severity is B1 because the injury affected one individual and did not result in First Aid. The Potential Severity is B1 because it is unlikely that the injury would have resulted in more than First Aid.
ImmediateAction: Contacted HSE

ShortDescription: he put his right hand on a hot pipe in service. He burnt the palm of his right hand.
FullDescription: At approximately 10h00 the IP was in the WOC ( walk on ceiling) level 2 north west side to check some HVAC instrumentation, to reach the work area he put his right hand on a hot pipe in service ( the IP was not wearing  safety gloves). He unfortunately managed to burn the palm of his right hand in the process.
ImmediateAction: The IP immediately report the incident to Wood HSSE and receive first aid treatment on site. The investigation has been started.

ShortDescription: Damaged electrical junction box.
FullDescription: At approximately 10:00am on Friday 2nd September, a managed contractor observed an un-connected electrical junction box had been damaged by a steel pile. The conditions during the morning were clear and sunny with no issues with lighting being identified. Piling contractor was instructed to remove pile to ensure safe removal of junction box.
ImmediateAction: Damage was reported to the managed electrical contractor supervisor. Junction box removed from site.

ShortDescription: Discrepancies in electrical wiring observed prior to installing electrical cubicle
FullDescription: On Friday the 2nd September ABB were carrying out refurbishing work on an electrical cubical. When removing the covers off the cubicle slots it was observed by an ABB employee that there was discrepancies in the electrical wiring (there were 2x cable connecting units (CCU) and the CCUs had copper bars installed on them linked between the phases of the CCUs) which was not to the design they had been provided with. Upon noticing the discrepancy ABB stopped the job and reported the issue. Potential subject to change pending investigation.
ImmediateAction: Upon noticing the discrepancy ABB stopped the job and reported the issue and started investigation.

ShortDescription: Driller did not follow procedure when lowering mast on drilling rig at a location in the grass area west of the bulk plant. No injuries
FullDescription: Driller was starting to lower the mast of the drilling rig, but missed a step in the procedure. The shaft that runs from auger drive near the motor, midway up the mast was left in the auger drive. When the driller went to lower the mast, it bent the shaft and caused the housing at the top point to crack and a piece of the housing fell and landed on the side of the rig. No injuries
ImmediateAction: Job postponed until rig could be repaired.

ShortDescription: Non preventable, company vehicle, minor damage, no injury.
FullDescription: While driving at Anthony Henday Drive for mobilzation for Site C, the Hyundai Santa Fe in front of IP slowed down due to construction zone, IP also slowed down in turn. The Honda CRV behind IP hit back bumper and caused truck to moved forward into the Hyundai Santa Fe.
ImmediateAction: Internal reporting initiated.

Project: US East - Oil & Gas - Gulf Coast
ShortDescription: I&E Technician received minor burns to the left cheek from breaker panel enclosure arc flash.
FullDescription: Wood I&E Technician was asked to close a 480V/1200A breaker enclosure door after the client supervisor completed a breaker replacement. As the IP closed the enclosure door with insulated gloves on, the door pushed against the breaker switch causing an arc flash, resulting in minor burns to the IP's left cheek and lip and damage to the breaker and enclosure. Axiom medical provided consultation to the IP and recommended first aid measures for the course of treatment. Actual: B1-First Aid applied to injury. Potential: B-5 Potential electrocution resulting in serious injury or fatality.
ImmediateAction: Distribution supply was isolated and locked out. IP evaluated by Axiom medical.

ShortDescription: A Wood truck was stolen as it was parked outside an employee's house.
FullDescription: On Thursday, September 1, 2022, unit 01.60.9965 was parked out side the employees residence in Hobbs, New Mexico.  At 1:43 am unknown persons entered the truck and drove off with it.  The Geo tab device was removed from the truck at 2:07 am as it was driving near mile marker 6, on the Carlsbad Highway west of Hobbs, New Mexico.  The theft was reported to the Hobbs Police Department.  The truck was recovered on September 4, 2022.  The "Wood" door stickers were removed but the truck had no physical damage.
ImmediateAction: The US fleet manager, Senior HSSES Manager, Project Manager and supervisor were notified of the incident.  The Hobbs Police Department was notified of the theft.

ShortDescription: Wood staffs infected Covid-19 over the past week (cumulative). All are stable and under home isolation
FullDescription: Wood staff infected Covid-19 over the past week (cumulative). All are stable and under home isolation.
ImmediateAction: 1. IP notified the line manager and HSSE department.2. IP seeks medical advice and undertakes home isolation.3. Close contact commenced 4. Update status of the situation in BCP meeting

ShortDescription: Person in camp tested positive to Covid 19.
FullDescription: Person in camp tested positive to Covid 19. Required to isolate for at leas 5 days.
ImmediateAction: Required to isolate for at leas 5 days.

ShortDescription: Excavator attachment damaged 14" pipe string
FullDescription: Nacap 3OT Excavator PP1985 contacted an above ground 14” pipe string at KP9+100, having just completed shading of the nearby trench, the excavator operator engaged the quick release hitch on the shaker bucket over the end of a pipe string, this resulted in the shaker bucket causing damage to the 14” pipe string coating.Nobody in line of fireNo potential to any person
ImmediateAction: Client notifiedOperator taken for post incident A&D testing - Neg for any intoxicants

ShortDescription: IP slipped on the stairwell landing while exiting from the 3rd floor.
FullDescription: On the 31st of August approx. at 10.45 am, a WOODKSS-managed contractor slipped on the staircase landing area of the 3rd floor while walking to the ground floor meeting room. IP was offered medical inspection/x-ray however he reported no pain or noticeable signs of injury and IP has refused Medical Attention.
ImmediateAction: IP has been interviewed, then he went to the meeting. The case has been reported to the Agency rep. The Agency rep arranged a Medical check-up, however, IP refused medical attention. IP was interviewed after 4 hours, however, IP reported that no complaints or damage to his back.

ShortDescription: IP received tick bite on top of right ear.
FullDescription: Staff members were conducting flow meter installation in the Brightview area (based out of Mt Crosby) when one of the team was bitten by a tick on the top of his right ear.
ImmediateAction: IP administered first aid and undertook precautionary review at medical centre - cleared for not further treatment.

ShortDescription: Offshore Outbound passenger initially boarded aircraft without lifejacket.
FullDescription: During inspection the flight captain identified the missing jacket and requested Wood passenger to don a life jacket. Passenger complied. Wood to reinforce to importance of heeding the pre-flight video and the importance of all passengers wearing lifejackets off-shore.
ImmediateAction: During inspection the flight captain identified the missing jacket and requested Wood passenger to don a life jacket. Passenger complied. This event has been reported in the client IMPACT system as a Near Miss.
OtherHazardSource: No life jacket worn prior to boarding helicopter

Project: US East - Oil & Gas - All Other Clients
ShortDescription: IP was wrapping up a 2 inch hose on a rack and felt discomfort in his abdomen.
FullDescription: IP had disconnected a 2 inch hose from a frack tank. He and a coworker started wrapping up the 50 foot long hose onto a spool that was about 3 foot high. As he pulled the hose from left to right, he felt discomfort in his abdomen. He reported it to his supervisor and was sent in for evaluation. The actual severity of the event is B1 as the IP received First Aid treatment. The potential severity is B2 due to the injury could have been more severe if he things has gone differently.
ImmediateAction: IP reported event to his supervisor and he was sent in for evaluation.

ShortDescription: Wood Company vehicle was rear-ended while stop on red light
FullDescription: On August 31, 2022, at approximately 4:00pm, a Wood employee was traveling home to enjoy their turnaround. Employee was driving on W main St. when the intersection light turns red. Employee knowing that the light was solid red makes a complete stop putting foot on the break. When employee was patiently waiting behind a blue Toyota Camry for the light to turn green, a gray F150 truck hit the Wood vehicle from behind causing a rear-ended collision. HSSE was notified and local law enforcement was called to gather information and investigation statements. The actual and potential severity rating is rated as an A1 since damage is estimated to be minor loss, less than 10k
ImmediateAction: The incident was immediately reported to HSSE and Operations. Incident investigation protocols were put in place and local law enforcement was contact. The scene was frozen, Daily vehicle inspection was gathered and present, photos of the incident/damage were collected. Law enforcement gather information and proof of insurance.

ShortDescription: Wood Mechanical Technician nipped the top of their thumb on the sharp edge of the Fire Pump Housing
FullDescription: The IP, a Wood Mechanical Technician, was in the process of removing the housing cover of the Fire Pump.The roof cover and the top side cover panels were both successfully removed using rigging equipment. The lower side cover panel had some welded pipe penetrating through it which prevented the cover from being removed.The work party used their Stop Work Authority and discussed what needed to be done to remove the penetration.A new 'use of air tools' permit was taken out, a TBT was completed and documented how the work party were going to continue.Once agreed, the IP began cutting the welded penetration. During the final cut, the cover panel sprung (moved) resulting in the newly cut section of cover panel coming into contact with the tip of the IP's right thumb.The work party did not know that there was stored energy within the cover panel.
ImmediateAction: IP & work party stopped work.IP was escorted to the Medic.Medic cleaned the wound and discovered the tip & nail of the IP's right thumb had been cut off.IP was medevac'd to Aberdeen Royal Infirmary.IP remained in hospital over night.IP was given an x-ray and is now awaiting the results of the x-ray to be viewed by the consultant before deciding if any surgery or further treatment is required.

ShortDescription: Team member was stung by multiple Ground Bees on multiple body parts.
FullDescription: A team member was tasked with weed eating the grass underneath the cabline in Block 4 when ground bees became aggressive. The team member tried to quickly remove themselves from the area, but the bees followed resulting in multiple stings to multiple parts of his body. First aid was administered and team member was monitored for a couple of hours. Team member returned to regular duty.  No witnesses in area.
ImmediateAction: Ceased work activity in that area. Sprayed Ground Bees with Wasp and hornet spray. Advised all crew members to stay out of the area. A safety stand-down was conducted with all hands after lunch to communicate incident and awareness.

ShortDescription: One (1) Massy Wood employee tested positive for COVID-19.
FullDescription: One (1) Massy Wood employee tested positive for COVID-19.
ImmediateAction: Employee taken to designated quarantine area to await demobilization.

ShortDescription: On-site vehicle collision involving FSHV and Wood 4x4
FullDescription: While FSHV Operative Was Leaving The Welfare Unit, He Reversed Backwards Where He Made Contact With The Right Hand Side Of The Wood 4x4 While Was Parked Alongside
ImmediateAction: Operative Stopped Vehicle and Assessed Damage Before Reporting Incident. FSHV Operative Taken To Connell Park By Site Manager For D&A

ShortDescription: One Wood employee tested positive for COVID while in the hotel waiting for embark.
FullDescription: One Wood employee tested positive for COVID while in the hotel waiting for embark.
ImmediateAction: Isolation and medical recommendation.

ShortDescription: One Wood employee tested positive for COVID while in the hotel waiting for embark.
FullDescription: One Wood employee tested positive for COVID while in the hotel waiting for embark.
ImmediateAction: Isolation and medical recommendation.

ShortDescription: Excavator bucket struck the GPS mast on the support dozer breaking it off
FullDescription: The Volvo EC750 excavator was digging a ditch in support of the CAT D6T dozer sloping the sides of the ditch with the excavator.  The excavator had been pulled into the area with the tracks backwards to the cab.  It was necessary to use the forward control to go backwards.  The operator turned the excavator around and the directional controls went back to normal for moving forward/backward.   The excavator operator needed to move back wards to reposition, but lost focus and forgot the controls were functioning normally.  He moved forward into the path of the dozer where the excavator bucket struck the GPS mast and breaking it off the dozer.
ImmediateAction: Operators stopped immediately and called their supervisor to report the incident.HSSE personnel went to the site of the incident and conducted an investigation.

ShortDescription: One Wood employee tested positive for COVID during premobilization screening.
FullDescription: One Wood employee tested positive for COVID during premobilization screening. EE is asymptomatic and returned home for isolation. No contact tracing required.
ImmediateAction: EE returned home for isolation and RTW process.

ShortDescription: A Wood employee was diagnosed positive for COVID-19 while visiting a client’s site.
FullDescription: One of the Mining Consulting team members was diagnosed positive for COVID-19 while visiting a client’s remote site in Alaska. The employee isolated in a camp facility and returned home when tested negative.
ImmediateAction: The employee isolated in the client camp facility and was monitored by the client's company Doctor. The HSSE and P&O dept. were notified.

ShortDescription: IP walked to the site portable washrooms near the road. Inside the washroom IP was bitten on the back of the leg twice by (a) red/fire ant
FullDescription: IP walked to the site portable washrooms near the road. Inside the washroom IP was bitten on the back of the leg twice by (a) red/fire ant.
ImmediateAction: The IP reported it to field supervisor immediately by phone. The IP was given an antiseptic wipe and an Afterbite ointment when returned to site.

ShortDescription: IP received minor cut to forehead
FullDescription: While working under permit 60521, electrical tech was installing a replacement T3 Transformer in LUP-7501A (QU UPS Switchroom) and was checking the electrical connections at the rear and side of the cubicle. This is quite a tight restrictive space and as the IP bent down in the space, he bumped his forehead on part of the internal cabinet. This resulted in a small cut (2.5cm) on the left of the forehead. He was not aware of this cut until after he came back out to the front of the cabinets and removed his hard hat. It was at this time that the vendor noticed the cut on his forehead, IP reported to medic who cleaned and dressed the cut. Supervisor held spatial awareness discussion at time of completion of INF form.Site visit was undertaken by HSEA Supervisor as an action and the team had identified and put in place some foam protection strips to the most exposed areas. However, the design of the cabinet and also the tight restricted space there was nothing more further that can be done. TBT highlighted the hazard of working in the required working space and the correct PPE was observed in place. No further actions required
ImmediateAction: IP visited the medic who cleaned and dressed the wound. IP returned to work. Foam protection strips applied to the most exposed areas of the structure.

ShortDescription: Wood employee were shot at with an Airsoft Type Pellet by a member of the general public, no Injuries.
FullDescription: Well installation crew member shot at by a air powered plastic pellets, similar to Airsoft pellets. The pellets were fired from a passing silver color sedan with at least 2 men estimated to be under 21 years old. 1 Wood employee was hit once in the left shoulder but no sustained no injuries.
ImmediateAction: Work end for the day and Wood crew contacted the Jackson Police department to provide a witness statement. Case # 497-21831-22 was opened by the PD

The pellets were fired from a passing silver color sedan with at least 2 men estimated to be under 21 years old. 1 Wood employee was hit once in the left shoulder but no sustained no injuries.
ImmediateAction: Work end for the day and Wood crew contacted the Jackson Police department to provide a witness statement. Case # 497-21831-22 was opened by the PD

ShortDescription: CP-2022-0079 FA Fournier; sprain right middle finger
FullDescription: IP was loading a box into a light vehicle, when IP’s hand slipped and contacted the underside protrusion of the tonneau cover which caused a sprain to right middle finger.
ImmediateAction: Work stopped. IP was taken to onsite PA who assessed and was given ice and a finger guard. IP returned to work. Incident Investigation initiated.

ShortDescription: A managed contractor employee tested positive for COVID-19.
FullDescription: A managed contractor employee tested positive for COVID-19 whilst offsite.
ImmediateAction: Managed contractor employee self-isolated.

ShortDescription: Drop of chemical dripped on employee's left check.
FullDescription: The employee was looking upward at existing piping to complete an inspection when a drop of liquid from above hit the employee in their left cheek. The liquid came from a valve that had been recently worked on. The employee started to feel a burning sensation.  The employee was immediately escorted by a Celanese employee to the safety shower to rinse off the liquid.  The employee was then escorted to the rest room area where their cheek was washed with soap and water.  The Celanese staff applied burn cream to the pea sized the area.  The employee was released from care. The actual severity is a B-1 as first aid measures were taken. The potential severity is a B-2 as the incident could have resulted in a medical treatment case.
ImmediateAction: First aid treatment provided

ShortDescription: A Wood employee hit a deer on his morning commute causing minor damage.

A deer ran out from the left side of the road into the driver side of the back passenger side door causing minor damage. The Actual Severity is A1 because the damage caused to the truck is less than $10,000. The Potential Severity is A1 because it is unlikely that the damage caused to the truck is more than $10,000.

FullDescription: An employee whilst traversing tripped on a scaffold board and felled on his knees.  The potential for serious injury was negligible.

ShortDescription: IP suffered small puncture wound to his right hand on base of his index finger
FullDescription: At 10.30am on the 30th August 2022 while working on the Glen Lyon Pigging Deck, the IP (KAEFER employee) L3 Rope access rigger was carrying out a cleaning task on the pigging tool using a rag and WD40 when the IP suffered a small puncture wound to his right hand index finger. The incident happened when the locking wire part of the system pierced through the rag that was being used to clean the unit and the nitrile glove which he was wearing at the time to protect his hands from oil and the protective glove (EN 388) as part of his normal PPE he was wearing over the nitrile gloves.The IP reported the incident to his supervisor and attended the medic for treatment to clean the wound and apply a plaster. The IP then returned to normal work duties.
ImmediateAction: IP immediately reported to his supervisor and then the medic. The IP,s finger was cleaned up by the medic and a plaster was applied to the wound.IP returned to normal work duties after the treatment.

ShortDescription: Car accident involving 3 Wood employees while returning from Site. Asset Damage only, no Injuries
FullDescription: 3 Wood employees were in a transport subcontractor vehicle being driven by the subcontractors driver traveling back from the Port of Rio de Janeiro to the Local Wood Office. On the road (6 lane intercity highway with small medium separator) a third party vehicle driving in the opposite direction lost control due to rainy conditions, (possible speeding) and the curve in the road thus hitting the medium and jumping to the opposite lane striking the vehicle that the Wood employees were travelling in. The collision resulted in asset damage to both vehicles with  no injuries to any of the 04 occupants or the 3rd party driver.
ImmediateAction: All occupants were taken to a local Clinic to ensure that no injuries occurred. Dr. released all employees and Driver with no a note of no injuries sustained. trip was suspended for 1 week pending incident investigation.

ShortDescription: One (1) Massy Wood employee tested positive for COVID-19.
FullDescription: One (1) Massy Wood employee tested positive for COVID-19.
ImmediateAction: Employee taken to designated quarantine area to await demobilization.

ShortDescription: I.P. was using the Bull float during the 2nd half of the flow field pour and received concrete burns to their legs.
FullDescription: While pouring concrete at the MDU Heskett location, an employee came into contact with wet concrete.  The employee was wearing rubber boots, rubber gloves, and a faceshield in addition to their standard PPE, but nothing to protect their legs beyond work pants.  At the time, the employee did not report the incident, and chose to continue to work his shift, take a shower, and treat the injury on his own.  The next day, the employee calls in to say he is taking the day off, as his legs are sore.  Sometime later in the day (8/31/2022) Employee reports the injury to site safety.  Site Safety reports injury, and is instructed to contact Occucare for medical guidance and a case is opened. Currently, the actual/potential of the incident is a B1/B2.  Had the IP waited longer, the injury could have become more severe and resulted in a medical treatment case.
ImmediateAction: Meet up with IP and Occucare was notified, and photos of injury sent to Doctor on call.  After interviewing the IP, the on-call doctor recommended ibuprofen, an antimicrobial dressing treated with burn cream. The IP will follow-up with the Occucare Doctor on Friday 02,2022.

ShortDescription: Employee opening bay door when shovel hanging nearby caught on bay door, lifted with the bay door then dropped to ground next to employee
FullDescription: Employee parked a truck at the bay door, went inside to open the bay door, a hanging shovel next to the bay door got caught on the bay door causing it to be lifted and fall to the ground (approximately 8 feet). The shovel had not been properly hung up by the previous user causing the head of the shover to sit on the bay door hinge. Martin Jung alerted Brittany Cunningham as she opened the door and saw the shovel start to move. Brittany was able to move out of the way safely.
ImmediateAction: Shovel hung up correctly

ShortDescription: Preventable, company vehicle. medium damage, no injury,
FullDescription: compound was broken into late night 28 August 2022, which resulted in damage to the west compound gate.  Fleet truck 10118 had been left unlocked with keys in it, and was taken from the compound.  The scratched and dents are suspected to be from contact with the gate on the way out of the compound.   The truck was noted missing on the morning of 29 August 2022, and was tracked  using the Donlen telematics app.  The telematics device was still active, and the vehicle was located in Raymond, about 30 km from the office.  911 was contacted. and a report filed.  Wood staff travelled to Raymond and located the vehicle.  Once the vehicle had been located, the local RCMP detachment in Raymond was contacted, and shortly thereafter two RCMP officers arrived at the truck.  All of the contents were still in the truck (except for the key), along with a gas-powered quick-cut saw, pair of blue jeans, and stuffed buffalo head, as well as an empty vodka container.  The 'additional' items were taken by the RCMP officers as evidence, and the truck was released to us.
ImmediateAction: tracking & recovery. The truck was back at the office at 10.30 am 29 August 2022.  Later the incident was reported to Donlen, and arrangements were made to take the truck to a local body shop for repair estimate.  Donlen has cancelled and re-issued the gas card.  The gate to the compound sustained some damage, and was repaired by John Lobbezoo on 29 August 2022.
WorkActivities: No work activity being carried out at the time of the incident

ShortDescription: A 8 SGT employee tested positive for COVID-19.
FullDescription: A 8 SGT employee tested positive for COVID-19 over the weekend.

ShortDescription: Bee Sting
FullDescription: At approximately 1040 SBI employee was stung by a bee while cleaning up around the service trailers located on the south west corner of the facility pad.  The employee notified SBI safety immediately.
ImmediateAction: Employee was transported to the Dry Valley office where he self administered Allegra and Zyrtec.  Employee stated he sometimes experiences and allergic reaction to bee stings.  Employee was monitored for 15 min with no adverse reactions.

FullDescription: 3 staff were identified as ATK positive results from weekly ATK testing and then IPs were confirmed by hospital. All cases were under home isolation. No one was in severe symptoms. (This is cumulative infected cases since 2-28 August 2022).
ImmediateAction: 1. Subcontractor disinfected the working area & temporary office. And increased disinfection 1 times/day at temporary canteen. 2. Provided daily inspection checklist for COVID 19 measurement. 3. Isolate high risk/close contact out off working. 4. Provide the regulation "No mask no talk, No mask no meeting"

ShortDescription: A managed contractor employee tested positive for COVID-19.
FullDescription: A managed contractor employee tested positive for COVID-19 whilst offisite.
ImmediateAction: Managed contractor employee self-isolated.

ShortDescription: Wood Lease operator received an Epidermis skin abrasion on his lower right forearm while reliving casing pressure.
FullDescription: On Sunday, August 28, 2022, at approximately 08:45, the IP was tasked with going around and blowing down excess pressure on the nitrogen injection casing lines.  The pressure on the nitrogen injection casing is relieved on a weekly basis and kept below 500psi.  The IP was wearing appropriate PPE including long sleeve FR shirt and gloves.  As the IP opened the 1 inch baylon valve, he noticed the line was loose and attempted to hold the valve assembly with his free hand and open the valve a little more; the assembly moved causing the discharge to brush up his right lower forearm.  The IP received an Epidermis skin abrasion on his lower right forearm and was prescribed antibiotics as a precautionary measure against infection. The Actual Severity is B2 because the injury resulted in a MTC.  The Potential Severity is B2 because the injury was unlikely to have been a significant injury or health affect.
ImmediateAction: The IP went to the control room and cleaned the affected area.  HSE was notified and decided to take the IP to the local ER to have the affected area cleaned and evaluated.

ShortDescription: Skid Steer rolled onto side after backing into ditch
FullDescription: On the morning of Sunday, August 28th, at approximately 9:30 AM, a Coal Handling Operations crew was working to clean up a pile of spilled coal around the Stacker Reclaimer that had been caused by a backup in the chute. An operator was using a wheeled skid steer with a scoop attachment to move the coal, which required repeatedly driving forward towards, and in reverse away from the coal pile.  During one reverse movement, the skid steer approached a shallow ditch (~2 ft. deep) that runs parallel to the reclaimer's track. The right rear tire of the skid steer went over the sloped edge of the ditch and the skid steer rolled into it, coming to rest on its right side.  Operator was not working with a spotter, but there was a ground man assigned to control access to the area for the duration of clean up. Operator reported no injuries and the next closest worker was ~25 feet off the front left side of the skid steer at time of incident.  There was no visible damage observed on the skid steer after being tipped back upright. An actual severity of A1 was selected as there were no injuries and no observable damage.  A potential severity of B2 was determined due to the potential for the operator to have been injured during roll over and potential for damage to the skid steer.
ImmediateAction: Work stopped, supervisor and client proponent notified.  Skid Steer removed from service pending inspection by vendor.  Reported to Wood management and safety the following morning 8/29/2022, incident investigation procedures initiated. Operator certification suspended, pending investigation.

FullDescription: IP and co-worker were tasked with placing a small portion of an I-beam to ensure it would fit. IP lifted I-beam (over the procedural limit of 50lbs) to hold the section in place when IP felt pain in upper right shoulder.
ImmediateAction: Work stopped and supervisor contacted. IP was taken to onsite PA who assessed and sent to Timmins for further assessment. IP received prescription medication. IP returned to work. Incident Investigation initiated.

ShortDescription: Rechargeable portable light caught fire in container office
FullDescription: A portable rechargeable LED Flood light caught fire inside a container office while it was being charged. Two supervisors were in office about 1.5m away from the charging point when a “pop” sound came from the unit. They saw a small fire and black smoke coming out from the rear of the unit which is the battery compartment. One of them used water from a nearby water bottle to put out the fire.
ImmediateAction: Fire was put off immediatelyAll the switches were off.Office container was not allowed to be used pending investigationInvestigation initiated

ShortDescription: 2x deep fat fryers left on in the restaurant kitchen.
FullDescription: Whilst carrying out their rounds, security noticed 2 x deep fat fryers was still on showing a naked flame.
ImmediateAction: Security immediately turned off the deep fat fryers in the restaurant. Security then logged and reported the incident.

ShortDescription: Rented differential pressure monitor (Omniguard 4) was stolen from vacant residential unit overnight at former AO Smith site in Newark, CA
FullDescription: An indoor air investigation was to be conducted at the AO Smith site involving the collection of samples over a 24-hour period. The apartment unit to be sampled was a vacant ground floor apartment unit. The unit was aired out the week prior to sampling. On Tuesday, August 23, 2022, the apartment complex maintenance staff closed the windows and doors and Wood staff confimed the windows were shut but did not check that they were locked. On Thursday, August 25, 2022, two Wood staff set up the indoor air sampling canisters and a differential pressure monitor (Omniguard 4) which was set up on a vapor pin in the master bedroom closet.  The next day, August 26, 2022, the Wood staff entered the unit at 8 am to collect the samples but found the Omniguard was missing. A window was open approximately one or two inches wide and there was no screen on the window. When the apartment management was contacted, they confirmed that no other workers had been in the unit. The conclusion was reached that the equipment was burglarized.
ImmediateAction: Filed police report when equipment was discovered missing
WorkActivities: No work activity being carried out at the time of the incident

ShortDescription: H2S alarm sounded whilst welder who was using a torch to remove glass coating was working inside dual media filter vessel
FullDescription: Work party were carrying out a Confined Space and Hot Work Open Flame task in the Dual Media Filter (DMF). Whilst the welder was inside the DMF using a propane torch to burn off the glass coating prior to welding, the gas monitor on the floor adjacent to task began to sound. The welder immediately left the DMF and in less than 20 seconds the alarm reset. Work party decided to continue with the task, reasoning that the personal gas monitor worn by the Welder in the DMF plus another gas monitor at waist height had not sounded. The same gas monitor sounded a further 2 times and again a decision was made to continue the task. Following a ETAP Verification on the task and reporting in the OIM's daily work review meeting, a decision was made to stop the task and stand the work party down to investigate the perceived alarms and responses of the work party.
ImmediateAction: Task was eventually stopped and the team stood down, further controls to allow the work to continue are being considered.

ShortDescription: Battery power tool C/W spare batteries stored within temporary rope access shelter
FullDescription: During a 'Boots on Deck' platform leadership visit / site audit with the Clair Ridge SSL and Clair Ridge OIM, it was observed that a battery power tool c/w 2 spare batteries was being stored in a temporary rope access habitat on the Cellar Deck on the N/E corner of the platform in a zone 2 area  , where the Wood team were storing materials for the C1 Cassion scopes. Power tool was relocated to a designated safe storage area and platform investigation ongoing.
ImmediateAction: Mag Base drill and batteries were relocated immediately to a designated safe storage area.Wood FTL once informed hels a time out for safety meeting with the team to remind them of the platform expectations regarding the storage of power tools.Rope access shelter has been requested to be dismantled to reduce the risk of tooling being stored within in future.
WorkActivities: No work activity being carried out at the time of the incident

ShortDescription: The IP reported soreness in his right shoulder due to frequent heavy lifting and carrying of samples
FullDescription: The IP was experiencing soreness in his shoulder for the past couple of night shifts from repetitive lifting and carrying of concrete cylinders (13kg).  He visited the Site C Camp Clinic after his shift.   He visited a First Aid Station on the following evening.
ImmediateAction: The IP reported to the Camp Medical Clinic after his shift.   He was asked to visit First Aid for assessment instead.  He went to First Aid the following night.
